channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan is visited by renowned snooker player and commentator Willie Thorne who wants to do a deal on an original artwork, and a world champion Thai boxer hopes to pawn three of his championship belts. At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, Nathan and assistant Deb test-drive an ice-cream van that owner Sam wishes to sell, and Tom has a diamond ring he wants to dispose of.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Hastings to help two couples look for their dream homes. However, with extravagant ideas and limited budgets on the agenda, they have their work cut out locating suitable properties. Jakki and Scott are determined to find a house before the arrival of their baby, while newlyweds Chris and Nicola want a two-bedroom family home in a great location.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to find out what they have been paid. Shelley and Linda from The Five Bells want to know why their feedback for breakfast doesn't add up, while Gez from the Thomas Paine Hotel wants to find out why Shelley and Linda scored him so low. Chris and Sarah from The Rose and Crown want to question Gez, and Steve and Lesley from Woodlands Guest House try to get to the naked truth.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Zoe Bailey hosts the first dinner party in Shropshire, and the Zumba instructor is hoping to entertain with a game of gargling while humming a tune. She devises a menu featuring a souffle starter, which goes down well with her guests - artist Penny Timmis, travelling salesman Richard Mercer, radio DJ Paul Shuttleworth and Josh Sedgeley.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Artist and dairy farmer Penny Timmis hosts the second dinner party in Shropshire, hoping her dentist posing as a magician is enough to divert her guests' attention away from the possible animal hairs in their food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: LED lighting salesman Richard Mercer hosts the third dinner party in Shropshire. He prepares a main course of paella, before suggesting a game of `Guess the Gadget' to entertain his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Youngest contestant of the week Josh Sedgley hosts the fourth dinner party from Shropshire. Some of the guests find his culinary efforts laughable, so he concentrates on the entertainment, which includes semi-naked butlers and a Las Vegas-style casino in his living room.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Traffic reporter and radio DJ Paul Shuttleworth hosts the final dinner party in Shropshire, and hopes that an evening of unusual outfits, fun food and a bouncy castle will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize. However, Paul's pork belly main doesn't live up to one guest's expectations.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide artist Zena Ellis as she takes her first step on to the housing ladder in Luton with a budget of £125,000. Also seeking assistance are new parents Lysan and Bo Cheng, who want to move out of London and return to Bedfordshire for a slower-paced family life, but find £550,000 doesn't go far in their chosen part of the country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Angela Keenan and Jon Benbow-Brown have visited Menorca five times together, and have fallen in love with the laid-back way of life on the island. The pair are planning to retire there full-time, so Ben Hillman shows them five houses on the island for their budget of £165,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer heads to the Tyne Valley, near Newcastle, to help Kerry Ellis and Michael Byrne, who have a budget of £150,000 to spend on their first property, but are finding house-hunting difficult as Kerry works in Manchester. Also in the area, Kirstie Allsopp searches for a rural home with a garden suitable for David and Kate Whitehead, who are expecting their second child.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Chelmsford, Essex, where they try to find a dream £1million house for internet entrepreneur Steve Clark and his wife Dee. A couple with a much more limited budget also seek help in finding a family home in the area.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies. Manchester agent Joe is caught between a single mother struggling to pay off her rent arrears and a landlord who has run out of patience. But unknown to Joe, his tenant has a plan to get herself out of this mess she has found herself in. Across town, letting agent Tracy is in for a shock when she discovers one of her tenants has turned a bedroom into an aviary full of tropical birds.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy's Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are often too distracted by their lively bar to look after their business. The national landmark, which has played host to an array of famous names including Mark Twain, President Ulysses S Grant and JP Morgan, has no dedicated accommodation manager, so guests sometimes struggle to receive the attention they need and end up feeling the hotel has become an afterthought beside the noisy saloon.(n)

programme.title: The 2,000,000 Calorie Buffet
programme.desc: Documentary about the growth in the number of all-you-can-eat restaurants offering limitless servings of food for a fixed price, featuring interview with diners who can eat four days of calories in one sitting and the canny restaurateurs who know every trick going to fill people up quickly. Narrated by Johnny Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Sunlight appears to transform water into liquid gold in California, a record-breaking heatwave wipes out thousands of bats in Australia, and weird weather makes sand dunes sing in the deserts of the Middle East. Plus, little-understood gravity waves captured on camera, how water can break apart rocks, why a lake in Canada is coming out in spots, and the unlucky tourist who visited the Grand Canyon, only to find the basin filled with thick fog.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe bring viewers up to date on the highs and lows from the World Para Athletics Championships, taking place in London. In this edition, the hosts are joined by Paralympic athletes Ellie Simmonds, Hannah Cockroft, Jonnie Peacock and Liam Malone.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: Three new participants enter the programme, while the others fight for acceptance in their pods and one participant is dragged into a confrontation that quickly turns physical.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Featuring a carpenter who nailed his hand to a plank of wood, and a woman who crushed her thumb in her boyfriend's car door. Narrated by Tom Davis.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the White Lodge Hotel in Filey, North Yorkshire, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of high standards will win over their guests.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Amanda Lucia-Charley and her friend Alan Talbot invite the other hoteliers to sample the delights of Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Alan introduces his alter-ego, Ada.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where pair Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest ends at glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, North Yorkshire, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow their guests with their unique `geodomes' and see-through pods.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the contest arrives, and while Amanda Lucia-Charley and Alan Talbot receive harsh criticism of their breakfast, Mark and Jean Lee's decor receives scathing reviews.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Zumba teacher Amanda hosts the first dinner party in Weston-super-Mare, where she hopes to impress her guests Harry, drama teacher Nancy, businesswoman Tracy and estate manager Chris with a locally sourced Somerset menu. Although the evening starts off with some friendly banter, it soon turns sour for some of the contestants.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby fan and sports centre manager Harry hosts the second night in Weston-super-Mare, where he hopes to wow his guests with a traditional Hungarian menu, complete with beef in hunter's sauce and bird's milk with meringue dumplings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Weston-super-Mare, drama teacher and music lover Nancy throws an Austrian-themed party to reflect her love of the country and its music, with a menu featuring wiener schnitzel and venison stew. The starter proves to be a hit with the guests, but her main course fails to impress, and the atmosphere grows tense when Chris compares her dessert to the worst food experience of his life.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm-estate manager Chris hosts the fourth party in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, and hopes his African-based menu can impress his guests. He serves savoury doughnuts, which are a new experience for his fellow diners. However, his main course of deep fried beef doesn't go down as well, leaving his chances of winning the competition resting on the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businesswoman Tracy hosts the final dinner party in Weston-super-Mare, and her dance-inspired evening includes lessons in cha-cha and tango as well as a black-tie dress code. Her guests tuck into a main course of steak cooked to each person's taste, which proves difficult to co-ordinate.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy's Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are often too distracted by their lively bar to look after their business. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavilion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives at Liverpool Women's Hospital face the mother of all shifts. With the maternity ward full, three couples manage to get a room, but have different experiences. Self-confessed princess Sarah and her devoted fiance Chris arrive eight weeks earlier than expected. Big kid Gary strives to grow up and become the responsible father and husband that his partner Claire demands. And Mormons Chloe and Daniel hope their new baby will bring them a step closer to the large and busy family they dream of.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The friends discover their old education records during a visit to their burnt-out school on Halloween, and it is not long before skeletons tumble out of the closet. programme.title: Serendipity

Romantic drama, starring Kate Beckinsale, John Cusack, Molly Shannon and Jeremy Piven.(n)

programme.title: Death Sentence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered executive Nick Hume's perfect, peaceful life is destroyed when his oldest son is killed by a street gang. Hume becomes determined to see those responsible pay for their crimes, gaining the sympathy and support of a homicide detective working on the case. However, she begins to question her position as Hume's methods of retribution become increasingly violent. Thriller, starring Kevin Bacon, Kelly Preston and Garrett Hedlund.(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: This rip-roaring remake of the 1965 adventure classic soars thanks to stunning aerial photography and fantastic special effects. Dennis Quaid plays a pilot whose plane crashes in the Gobi Desert, where he and his crew try to reconstruct their craft and fly it to safety. The film marks the directorial debut of John Moore. Tyrese Gibson, Miranda Otto, Giovanni Ribisi, Tony Curran, Kirk Jones (a.k.a. Sticky Fingaz), Hugh Laurie, Scott Michael Campbell, Jared Padalecki, Kevork Malikyan(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: In this action thriller, a master car thief has his skills pushed to the limit. Randall "Memphis" Raines (Nicolas Cage) can steal practically any car that crosses his path. While he has done well in his life of crime, he knows that there's a short future in theft, and he wants to get out of the business. But his retirement plans are interrupted when his younger brother Kip (Giovanni Ribisi) gets in trouble with a dangerous crime boss. To get his brother out of harm's way, Randall agrees to a profitable but risky scheme to steal 50 luxury cars in one night, with the help of several other car thieves, including Sara "Sway" Wayland (Angelina Jolie). A rival group of thieves is trying to pull the same stunt at the same time, and detectives Castlebeck (Delroy Lindo) and Drycoff (Timothy Olyphant) are trying to shut down both operations. Also starring Robert Duvall as Otto Halliwell, and Scott Caan as Tumbler, Gone in Sixty Seconds is a remake of the 1974 low-budget action hit of the same name, best remembered for a 40-minute chase scene in which 90 cars were destroyed(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Tough detective Popeye Doyle is left chasing shadows as he tries to nail one of the biggest drugs smugglers in New York, and possibly the world(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Directed by Walter Salles Jr., this remake of Hideo Nakata's supernatural psychological drama Honogurai Mizuno Soko Kara revolves around the plight of a single mother (Jennifer Connelly) whose messy divorce and subsequent battle for the custody of her five-year-old daughter is taking a heavy toll on her emotional well-being. Ultimately, the mother and daughter are able to relocate to an apartment, which, despite its excessively dilapidated interior, seems to be an adequate location for beginning a new life. Before long, however, what appears to be the spirit of a young girl begins to haunt them. No stranger to mental illness, the wary young woman brushes the visions aside as part of the inherent stress of making the transition from housewife to working, single mom. As time goes by and the apparent haunting does not subside, the apartment's new residents are forced to examine the history of its former tenants. Dark Water also features performances from John C. Reilly, Tim Roth, and Dougray Scott(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: Flashdance meets Cocktail in this salty romance. Violet arrives in New York with empty pockets but big dreams, taking a position as one of the sexy bartending 'coyotes' in a wild and packed bar(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: A cocky marketing student works in a bar to get by, but falls under the tutelage of an older barman, who encourages him to live a selfish, hedonistic lifestyle(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: Romantic comedy directed by Adam Brooks. Ryan Reynolds plays Will Hayes, an advertising executive whose marriage is on the cusp of ending in divorce. But before it does, his 10-year-old daughter Maya asks her father to explain how he met her mother. Instead of giving her a straight answer, Reynolds recounts his relationships with three women over the previous 16 years, changing their names and then inviting Maya to guess which woman he married. So, did Reynolds fall for his college sweetheart Emily; the kooky apolitical friend April he met while working on the Bill Clinton campaign in 1992; or is she the ambitious, carefree journalist Summer?(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: A group of twenty-something friends, most of whom live in the same apartment complex, search for love & success in grunge-era Seattle(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter turned singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same weddings(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: A silly, enthusiastic satire about a dim male supermodel (Ben Stiller) who loses ground to a newcomer (Owen Wilson), then unwittingly becomes involved in an assassination plot. Stiller also directed, co-wrote and co-produced. Stiller's wife, Christine Taylor, stars as his love interest and his father, Jerry Stiller, plays a slimy agent. Cameos by Donald Trump, David Bowie and Paris Hilton(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A female political consultant is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival, who is working on the opponent's campaign and is looking for every opportunity to antagonize her(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Sparks fly when a romance novelist teams up with a cocksure mercenary to save her kidnapped sister. Jungle caper starring Kathleen Turner and Michael Douglas(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: David Wain's comedy stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as a pair of irresponsible salesmen who find themselves acting as very unlikely role models for two wayward kids. Danny and Wheeler make their living promoting a high-energy drink to pupils as a wholesome alternative to drugs. The job fits perfectly with uber-slacker Wheeler's rock'n'roll lifestyle, while cynical Danny, whose focus is his girlfriend Beth, feels underused and that his life is dribbling away. However, neither men can find the motivation to grab life by the scruff - until, one day, they deliberately crash their truck and are given the choice between jail or community service. They choose the latter, becoming mentors to a 10-year-old breast-obsessed lad called Ronnie and teenage role-play gamer Augie. It's difficult to tell whose behaviour is worse, the children or the 'adults', but a battle of wills ensues, which will have a meaningful outcome for each of the quartet..(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Mike Myers' velvet-suited swinger returns in this groovy sequel to the popular spy spoof. The self-styled Casanova teams up with a CIA agent after Dr Evil steals his libido(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A very funny remake of Ernst Lubitsch's classic 1942 black comedy about actors who turn spies in World War II Warsaw. A theatre troupe are unwittingly embroiled in the Polish Resistance via a young freedom fighter who is carrying on an affair with the leading lady(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: This involving drama stars Vincent Gallo as the title character, an ill-tempered, brooding poet living in Argentina, who is visited by his younger brother after a long estrangement during which the younger brother thought Tetro might be dead. The two discuss their troubled relationship with their composer father and attempt to find some common ground. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Thumbs up to this cosmic comic joyride adapted from the Douglas Adams sci-fi cult adventures. Mos Def is a blast as alien planet-trotter Ford Prefect, and Martin Freeman is equally fun as earthling Arthur Dent, his traveling companion and best friend. Sam Rockwell costars as Ford's cousin, Zaphod Beeblebrox, a galactic president with three arms and two heads. The animatronic monsters were designed by Jim Henson's Creature Shop. Zooey Deschanel, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy, Anna Chancellor(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: Five years after jilting his pregnant fiancée on their wedding day, out-of-shape Dennis decides to run a marathon to win her back(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards overcomes all odds and extraordinary challenges to become the first British man to compete in the Olympic ski jump event, making him the most famous ski jumper in the history of Great Britain(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In 1820s America, frontiersman Hugh Glass is betrayed and left for dead by his fur-trapping party after he is viciously attacked by a grizzly bear. However, Glass survives and sets out to seek revenge(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: Stylish thriller in which a young man's life is turned upside down when the woman he loves suddenly disappears without trace. He last saw her as she headed towards the toilets at a service station, and he is convinced she has been kidnapped. Three years after the disappearance, he is still searching for her, even though the police have long since abandoned their investigations(n)

programme.title: Alien: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: The crew of a spacecraft fight off a terrifying extra-terrestrial invader in Ridley Scott's cut of his sci-fi classic(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: Mel Gibson crosses a post-apocalyptic wasteland to fight for a small community against gasoline raiders. A savage classic set in the Outback's brutal battleground(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett and Castle investigate the death of a professional skateboarder assassinated by a motorcyclist in his pursuit. Crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman's body is found in a lift, and McCoy finds his prosecution of the prime suspect hampered by a vindictive judge Ross offended in court.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a rare coin dealer, focusing their efforts on a millionaire who seems the most likely culprit - but Ross finds himself forced to play detective too. Sam Waterson and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The team investigates the murders of attorney Mitchell Hindle and mechanical engineer Justin Vanderheyden, with both victims turning out to have been shot with the same type of bullet. Adam hacks Justin's cell phone and finds that he was supposed to meet with a venture capitalist the night before, while Hawkes discovers that he had used 3D metal printing to create a gun. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Carmine Giovinazzo and Hill Harper.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Patient Killer
programme.desc: A hypnotherapist specialising in dreams blames herself for failing to prevent a patient's suicide two years ago. After setting up a new practice, she wonders if history is repeating itself when a new client with a similar condition asks for her help. Psychological thriller, starring Victoria Pratt and Casper Van Dien.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Patient Killer
programme.desc: A hypnotherapist specialising in dreams blames herself for failing to prevent a patient's suicide two years ago. After setting up a new practice, she wonders if history is repeating itself when a new client with a similar condition asks for her help. Psychological thriller, starring Victoria Pratt and Casper Van Dien.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Chief petty officer Leland Wiley dies of a heart attack just as he is about to reveal information on elusive arms dealer Agah Bayar. The team discovers the cardiac arrest was caused by someone hacking into a computer monitoring Wiley's pacemaker and increasing his heart rate to 400bpm. Meanwhile, a probationary agent tries to impress Gibbs and win a place on his team. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with Tamer Hassan and Matt L Jones.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The squad investigates when a wealthy man is found murdered, and discover his family were all striving to get their hands on the inheritance. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The shooting of a sleazy retired policeman in a neighborhood notorious for prostitution leads Briscoe and Curtis to two suburban housewives who are secretly moonlighting. However, it soon becomes apparent that whoever killed the victim could have been acting in self-defence. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: DB Russell heads to New York to help Mac search for his kidnapped girlfriend Christine, and James Boyd arranges to meet up with the gang to drop off the diamonds and release the hostages. With the CSI team monitoring his every movement, Boyd starts to ask too many questions and the captors begin to suspect he has involved the police. Conclusion of the two-part crossover between the Las Vegas and New York CSI franchises, starring Gary Sinise and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to track down wanted terrorist Harper Dearing before another US Navy ship is destroyed, and a desperate Gibbs enlists the aid of a prisoner to draw his target out of hiding. Meanwhile, Palmer is forced to consider putting his nuptials on hold as the stand-off with Dearing becomes heated. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: TJ and Morales pursue leads in connection with the murder of a student whose body was found dumped in a park. Initial inquires reveal her final evening was spent with one other girl and two young men in an isolated house experimenting with drugs and sex games, which the victim found overwhelming. Crime drama, starring Corey Stoll and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is found to be having a sexual relationship with one of her daughter's classmates, and investigations reveal she may also have supplied alcohol for a high-school party at which another student died. Guest starring Becca Mills (Grey's Anatomy) and Laura Leighton (Melrose Place).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson is forced to cooperate with an FBI agent trying to track down her brother, who is fleeing sexual assault charges. However, the pressure proves too much for her to handle, and she loses control during another case, prompting Cragen to send her home. Guest starring Vincent Spano (Rumble Fish), with Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard find themselves with a long list of suspects when they investigate the murder of a late-term abortion doctor in a church. The victim had been shot at and threatened on numerous occasions, and his wife is convinced the killer is a pro-life zealot. Meanwhile, Buren receives bad news, and Rubirosa faces a moral dilemma - triggering tension within the team.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac uncovers a murder on board a commercial flight from New York to Washington DC and sets up a makeshift crime lab to catch the killer. The case takes an unexpected twist with the discovery that the victim, an escaped convict with a history of drug-running, was posing as a federal air marshal to smuggle cash out of the country.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Evidence found at a murder scene links the victim to a number of high-profile figures, including police chief Brigham Sinclair and the benefactor who made Hawkes' career possible. The detectives learn the killer stole a data stick, but find their inquiries hindered by a private investigator trying to suppress sensitive information about his employer. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Mykelti Williamson.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Delko is rushed to hospital with potentially fatal gunshot wounds, and Horatio waits anxiously as medics try to revive him, while the rest of the team searches for his assailant. Calleigh and Ryan process the crime scene, and question a security guard who provides them with what appears to be vital information - until further evidence sheds new light on the case.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Hodges and Wendy attend a sci-fi convention, but the event is disrupted by the murder of a TV producer in attendance. The investigation soon highlights what can happen when a much-loved show is meddled with. Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

programme.title: A Date to Die For
programme.desc: A recent divorcee, suffering from bipolar disorder, accepts a date with a single father. The next morning, she awakens to find her date's dead body in her bed, a knife plunged in his chest. Trying to piece together her memories of the previous night, she sets out to defend her reputation and the lives of her family by locating the killer herself. Thriller, starring Victoria Pratt.(n)

programme.title: McBride: The Chameleon Murder
programme.desc: An apparently straightforward murder case takes a strange turn when the victim is discovered to have a plethora of identities - prompting McBride to investigate in an effort to prove his client innocent of the killing. Crime drama, starring John Larroquette, Marta DuBois, Annie LaRussa and Devon Gummersall.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Publish or Perish
programme.desc: A ruthless publisher hires a hitman to kill a best-selling author who has threatened to sign with a rival company - but reckons without the involvement of the cigar-smoking sleuth, who is determined to put the culprit behind bars. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Mickey Spillane, Jack Cassidy and John Chandler.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Confidential files are leaked by an anonymous hacker, who threatens to release more unless the Navy agrees to renew a contract with a struggling shipbuilding firm. The Navy Secretary suspects the company's owner Philip Wickes is to blame, and asks NCIS to join forces with the PsyOps unit in an elaborate ruse to bring the culprit out of hiding. Meanwhile, Gibbs' colleagues begin to notice his attraction to his opposite number Samantha Ryan. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance's brother-in-law Michael Thomas is linked to the murder of a petty officer, and Gibbs is placed under pressure to clear the man's name. Meanwhile, a negative performance review leaves Tony feeling downhearted and he resolves to prove the assessment wrong by being less chatty while on duty. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine lieutenant's body falls from the sky and the team links the man's death to the disappearance of a Navy chaplain thought to have been kidnapped by rebels working with Colombian crime cartels. Ziva and Tony are dispatched to conduct a rescue operation and enlist the help of former Interpol agent Monique Lisson, while Gibbs discovers there was more to the chaplain's outreach mission than meets the eye. Crime drama, guest starring Karina Lombard (The L Word) and Jamie Lee Curtis (A Fish Called Wanda).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A fire crew discovers a man's body after putting out a raging blaze at a warehouse belonging to a Navy-contracted electronics company, and Gibbs recognises the victim as Carter Plimpton - a former member of an NCIS black-ops unit. Meanwhile, a member of the Baltimore police department helping with the case appears to have a grudge against Tony.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. Meanwhile, Abby studies evidence relating to fire-starter Bruce Johnson, who died when his car exploded, and discovers coded messages in his quarters that indicate he may have been working as part of a larger gang. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam goes undercover inside a federal prison, posing as an inmate to investigate a terrorist group responsible for bombings worldwide, and Callen is given permission to pursue a clue to his past.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a drone pilot whose car had recently been sprayed with the word `killer'. A member of a protest group who objected to the military's use of drones admits to harassing victim Max Griggs, and though soon discounted as a suspect, leads the team to Griggs' secret store room where an unlicensed drone is recovered. This is found to have been used to shoot footage of land surrounding several military bases and it becomes clear Griggs was apparently looking for evidence that someone did not want to be discovered. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lachlan Colston, a lieutenant in the Royal Australian Navy, is murdered on US soil, prompting Special Investigator Naomi Parsons to travel to New Orleans from Australia to investigate. Evidence mounts suggesting that Colston's death was a hired hit, but when the team moves in to apprehend the assassin, Parsons' rash actions jeopardise the arrest. Suitably humbled, the Aussie agent agrees to tow the line as Pride and his colleagues learn that Colston may have been killed to derail a nuclear programme to be established on the Cocos Islands. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A priest asks Stabler to meet a terminally ill man who has a secret he wants to share with his estranged daughter, leading the detective to discover the patient's involvement in a series of unsolved bank robberies during the 1970s. As the investigation progresses, they find a bomb shelter containing millions of dollars and the skeleton of his former partner-in-crime. Guest starring Brian Dennehy and Paget Brewster, with Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman accuses her estranged husband of breaking into her home and raping her. As the man has no history of violence and the victim refuses to allow her daughter to answer questions, the detectives are split over where the truth lies, and Benson is concerned that Stabler's judgement is being clouded by his own divorce. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

Regular weekly features included "K9 Cops and Animal Heroes," "Celebrity Owners," and "Animal Bloopers." programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone returns to the character which made him famous in this wildly successful sequel. Rocky III starts with the Italian Stallion so famous that his likeness is everywhere, including pinball machines. Fame and complacency soon cause Balboa to lose his title to young thug Clubber Lang (Mr. T), who inadvertently causes the death of Rocky's beloved trainer, Mickey (Burgess Meredith), before their first championship bout. After sinking into a depression, Balboa must regain the love and support of his family, as well as the elusive "eye of the tiger," the hungry need to beat the opponent which former foe Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers) teaches him during this film's de rigueur training sequence. In the end, Balboa faces off against Lang for a second time. "Eye of the Tiger," the theme song Stallone commissioned from the band Survivor, became a huge hit single(n)

He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book "Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express," written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher(n)

When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

Billy Burke and Alexander DiPersia co-star. Produced by James Wan (The Conjuring), Lights Out is a feature-length expansion of director David F. Sandberg's short film of the same name, which became a viral sensation online(n)

programme.title: Chernobyl Diaries
programme.desc: An extreme vacation turns terrifying when a group of friends visit the Chernobyl disaster site, and learn that some nightmares never die. Conceived and produced by Paranormal Activity's Oren Peli, Chernobyl Diaries gets underway as six thrill-seeking tourists hire a fearless tour guide, and travel to the abandoned Ukrainian city of Pripyat. Back when the Chernobyl nuclear reactor was up and running, Pripyat was the place the workers called home. But 25 years after one of the worst power-plant accidents in history, the city serves as an eerily silent testament to the dangers of nuclear power. Later, after getting unexpectedly stranded in Pripyat, the tourists and their guide realize they are being hunted. Now the harder they try to flee, the faster their numbers dwindle until only a few are left standing. Only then will the unspeakable terror that stalks these deserted streets finally emerge from the shadows to launch one last relentless, terrifying attack(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber

programme.title: 9/11: The Falling Man
programme.desc: September 11 2001 was a day that forever changed America. It was a day of many stories: stories of survivors, stories of heroes. But one story simply disappeared. The story of the people who began to fall just minutes after the first plane hit. They were called the jumpers, but soon they were never spoken about again, as if they had never existed. One photograph stood for them all. Anyone who saw it never forgot it. It is one of the most unforgettable images from 9/11: a photograph of a falling man, frozen in mid-air, perfectly parallel with the lines of the World Trade Center. The image ran in newspapers and magazines across the world over the following week, and should have remained one of the defining images of that terrible day. Instead, it was quickly airbrushed out of history. 9/11: The Falling Man follows the trail of that photograph: of the photographer who nearly lost his life shooting it; of the citizens who decried it; of the editors who published it and then reluctantly banned it; of the journalists who tried to uncover the falling man's identity; of the wife and daughters of the identified man and many others. The film asks if this single, harrowing image can help to define our memory of the awful suffering of that day, and help history to give a proper due to the jumpers of 9/11(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: The team helps an occupational therapist whose spending on her family and friends is causing her to go into the red. With Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore an eight-bed house, a semi-detached and end-of-terrace property, all of which are about to be auctioned. They then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: A late night break-in in the Somerset Levels, turns from being a manhunt to a search-and-rescue for the neighbourhood team after it transpires the young suspect is lost and confused in freezing mid-winter conditions. Meanwhile, in Bath, the hunt is on for a street beggar, who has skipped his court appointment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville hear how one man's home was rented out to holiday-makers without him knowing anything about it.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts as Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help teams select items at the antiques fair at the Royal Highland Centre, Edinburgh, in the hope of making a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A prodigal's return to town brings torment for Sharon. Adrijan's rage flares again, while Angela and Tommy feel helpless against Conor's addiction.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Snowdonia with buyer who wants to downsize and move closer to relatives. For a £350,000 budget, she is seeking a new house as well as a new business and has brought her son along to help. Away from the house hunt, Jules learns about shepherding in the region's protected landscape.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At the tip, Sarah Moore prevents a sewage pipe, a blanket box and a cardboard box full of old plates from being dumped to landfill, transforming them into bespoke and valuable pieces. Back in Stockport, she reveals the transformations and hands over the profits to the people who had no idea that riches could be made from their rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: From Hopetoun House near Edinburgh, where antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley appraise some fascinating items to take to auction. Paul Martin visits the Queensferry Crossing over the Firth of Forth, which was the biggest engineering project in Scotland for a generation.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys quizzes another four famous faces on their specialist subjects. Those braving the black chair are Outnumbered actor Tyger Drew-Honey, radio presenter Tom Ravenscroft, actress Maria McErlane and writer of the Horrible History books Terry Deary. The quartet are quizzed on TV comedy The Office, Warp Records, socialite Unity Mitford and GK Chesterton's Father Brown stories respectively.(n)

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: The undercover Thief Tracker team uses GPS technology to track a gang whose members have stolen a bike, and confronts one of them to see if he will own up to the crime. The Metropolitan Police's Super Recogniser squad uses its special skills to track down a prolific shoplifter, while in Coventry a woman and her son are left traumatised when their car is stolen in a violent carjacking, but the criminals are traced by the police through footage from a camera hidden in the car.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The school prom is thrown into chaos, with severe consequences. Who is involved and what has happened? Max is forced to think on his feet after Carmel catches him looking at her private work documents. But whether she believes him remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville arranges a double date with Madge and Mavis for himself and Gastric - but has to smarten his friend up first. Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a potential new husband, Nurse Gladys is wooed by a man whose boil she once treated, while Eric and Cyril need to come up with some clever marketing ideas when a mysterious new product arrives in the shop.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back on his eventful career. Both Peter and his Phoenix Nights character Brian Potter receive mysterious phone calls, while in Car Share John and Kayleigh discuss naturists on their way home. Amy Winehouse also appears.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as a doting mother-of-six who constantly interferes in her children's lives. Agnes tries to solve her son Dermot's relationship problems by giving his girlfriend advice, and Grandad ends up in hospital after Dr Flynn's attempt to read his temperature goes awry.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and the children set off in their car to catch a ferry with plenty of time to spare - or so they think. As a consequence their plans for a welcome break prove anything but stress-free. Rob Brydon guest stars, with Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: You Again
programme.desc: A PR executive is outraged when her brother decides to marry the girl who made her life a misery when they were in high school. Her mother advises her to forget the past, but finds it hard to take her own advice when she learns the bride's aunt is her own teenage nemesis. Comedy, starring Kristen Bell, Jamie Lee Curtis, Sigourney Weaver and Odette Annable.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Tennis coach Judy Murray joins Matt Tebbutt to sample dishes prepared in the kitchen by chefs Paul Foster and Freddy Bird. Peter Richards selects the wines.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: New series. The Great British Bake Off 2015 champion Nadiya Hussain embarks on a culinary road trip around Britain, meeting with producers, farmers and fishermen across the country as she creates her own recipes inspired by their produce. In the first episode Nadiya begins her tour in the Home Counties, where she visits an asparagus farm in Oxford, before trying her hand at food smoking in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Nick Hall offer advice to two teams of antiques-hunters in Derby, who search for potentially profitable treasures to sell at auction in an extended edition of the show. Presenter Tim Wonnacott finds an unusual pair of glasses and visits the V&A Museum of Childhood in London.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces action from the 11th meeting of the season, which took place at Stade Louis II, and was expected to feature Usain Bolt in the 100m.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Herefordshire to advise a couple who have a budget of £650,000 to invest in a country home with holiday letting potential. While there, the presenter also visits the county's Rural Crafts Centre and learns the skills of blacksmithing.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Catherine Southon value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park, while presenter Paul Martin visits the Victoria and Albert Museum in Kensington, to examine its fascinating history and explore the architecture gallery.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Shrek the Third
programme.desc: The bad-tempered ogre finds himself in the unwelcome position of being next in line for the throne. Preferring to stay at home in the swamps, he sets out on a quest to find the rightful heir - a rebellious teenager named Artie - and persuade him to face up to his responsibilities as the future king. Meanwhile, the ambitious Prince Charming sees his chance for power. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas and Rupert Everett.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong quizzes another line-up of famous faces on the general knowledge game show. The teams are singer-turned-author Louise Wener and wildlife presenter Kate Humble, veteran Olympian Mary Peters and ice dance star Jayne Torvill, comedian Tony Hawks and broadcaster Henry Kelly and comedy duo Hale and Pace. Who'll be best when it comes to picking the most obscure correct responses? Richard Osman is the one with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The grand final of the singing contest arrives, as Mel Giedroyc assembles the six most successful entrants for their final performances. As ever, Gareth Malone and Kelis are tasked with assessing each group's skills, and for this last round, they are joined on the panel by Deke Sharon. The final begins with a musical mash-up, followed by a Showstopper round in which the ensembles collaborate with stars including Will Young, Chaka Khan, Bebe Rexha and Seal, among others. Three groups will be eliminated at this stage, leaving the other three to face off in an a capella contest, which will decide the two finalists. The ultimate winner will be named via public vote. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Scott is admitted to the ED after taking a nasty fall during a fight with Mickey, and while Ethan is initially assigned to take care of him, the powers-that-be quickly realise this is a bad idea. Meanwhile, with both her sons in hospital, Ellisson matriarch Denise turns up on the ward, and it is not long before she discovers the reason her boys were scrapping. Connie delights in bringing Grace into the department to show off her recovery, but when the youngster gets in the way of her mother's work, it becomes clear their relationship still isn't on an even keel.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Eagle Eye
programme.desc: Two strangers find themselves on the run from the authorities when they receive mysterious phone calls informing them their lives are in danger. They are forced to follow the instructions of a woman who is tracking their every move, while at the same time trying to discover who is behind the conspiracy. Thriller, starring Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan, Rosario Dawson and Michael Chiklis.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former deputy Prime Minister John Prescott joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that made him the person he is, including a cop drama featuring Brian Blessed.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Family members want to extend their home to care for a relative, only to get a wake-up call when an expert looks at their finances. Plus, how companies target nocturnal internet shoppers.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams hunt for bargains on London's Portobello Road with Natasha Raskin and Thomas Plant, while Charlie Ross tells the story of London's first passenger airport at Croydon.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The giant armadillo, an animal so elusive few have ever seen it wild in the Brazilian wetlands region known as the Pantanal. David Attenborough reveals how the burrows the armadillos dig create homes for hundreds of other animals. Until recently man knew virtually nothing of this species, but Arnaud Desbiez, the founder of the Giant Armadillo Project, has changed all that.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner arrive in West Yorkshire, where they visit one of the county's best-loved pubs and find themselves faced with a Yorkshire pudding. They also travel to the `rhubarb triangle' to learn more about the vegetable, and Brian serves up pan-fried mackerel with rhubarb batons, while Janet explores the grounds of Harewood House.(n)

programme.title: Caravanner of the Year
programme.desc: The three remaining couples work on their winning strategies as they battle it out to become Caravanner of the Year. In the final of the competition, the contestants must negotiate a demanding navigation test, and to add to the pressure, their driving skills are under scrutiny. However, the road restrictions and ban on Sat Navs quickly take their toll. Next, the camping enthusiasts take on the hospitality challenge, with Caravan Club Chairman Grenville Chamberlain, motorhome journalist Andy Harris, and guest judge Martin Dorey appraising their efforts before selecting the winner.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Zoologist Martin Hughes-Games presents more stories of endangered animals and the people dedicated to saving them. He meets a rare baby parrot so precious it has to be hand-reared, a newborn lemur whose life is hanging in the balance, a tiny wallaby in need of a foster mother and 11 birds that are being taught how to migrate by following a microlight. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Madagascar, Lemurs and Spies.
programme.desc: Documentary following a scientist who has joined forces with an undercover detective to explore threats to silky sifaka lemurs in Madagascar. The rainforest-dwelling animals are one of the world's rarest mammals, and the investigators find out whether there is a link between the endangered creatures, illegal logging and expensive American guitars.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion travel from Harrogate to York, Northallerton, Masham and Richmond, before rounding off their trip at an auction in Cobridge, Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts a game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adventurer Paul Rose concludes his exploration of the 79-mile Yorkshire Wolds Way, taking to the skies to get a unique view of its stretch of chalk downland. He also receives a special invitation to a military base that has been keeping the nation safe since the start of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: RHS: Tatton Flower Show 2017
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Monty Don and Joe Swift review the gardens created by the finalists in the RHS Young Designer of the Year competition, and reveal the winners of the prestigious Best Show Garden and Best Back to Back Garden. Arit Anderson examines a garden designed to adapt to the changing climate, while Carol Klein investigates the rise in popularity of cacti and succulents as house plants. Monty and Joe also take a fun trip down Bus Stop Boulevard to choose their favourite of the revamped bus shelters making their debut at this year's event.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour present highlights of the second day of the prestigious event, which takes place at Royal Birkdale Golf Club in Southport. Today's play will have seen the competitors attempting to make the cut and qualify for the weekend's rounds, and avoid the fate that befell several notable players at last year's event, including Ernie Els, Tommy Fleetwood, Paul Casey and Louis Oosthuizen. Fleetwood, who is from Southport, will be looking to perform well given that this tournament is taking place in his home town, and will hope to replicate the form that saw him triumph at the Open de France recently, just weeks after his fourth-placed finish at the US Open.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Phill Jupitus, Holly Walsh and Nish Kumar join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme `nonsense'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kamal Ahmed.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: Tui's friend Jamie is arrested for shoplifting groceries and Robin suspects he is feeding the 12-year-old and could be her baby's father. Matt Mitcham sends a posse of hunters into the Bush to find his daughter and Robin goes in after them, but tragedy strikes. Drama, starring Elisabeth Moss and Peter Mullan.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: Tui's due date is imminent and Robin is summoned to Matt Mitcham's, where what she hears leaves her in the depths of despair. The detective summons up her last reserves of strength to try to find the girl before her father can, but nothing can prepare her for where she will have to go, or what she will have to see. Thriller set in New Zealand, starring Elisabeth Moss and Peter Mullan. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Donald Trump fought the US presidential election with a promise to send millions of illegal immigrants back to Mexico, and this programme investigates how his controversial deportation plans are being put into action. Reporter Hilary Andersson meets families split by immigration arrests as well as children of detained parents left to fend for themselves, and accompanies police in Arizona as they hunt down illegals at night.(n)

programme.title: The Betrayed Girls
programme.desc: In May 2012, eight British-Pakistani men and an Afghan asylum-seeker were found guilty of the grooming, rape and sex trafficking of underage teenage girls in Rochdale, but it turned out that police and social services had known about the abusers for years and that the scandal went far beyond the Greater Manchester town. This feature-length documentary features testimonies from victims whose stories have not been told before and includes interviews with people who spoke out on behalf of the girls.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Animated adventure in which the Nektons explore the depths of the ocean. A dragon-hunting expedition leads Ant to find an ancient scroll that holds clues to an amazing mystery.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Dark Orca Pirates attack believing the Nektons have a rare treasure aboard their sub. To escape, Kaiko know he has to guide the Aronnax through an erupting, undersea volcano.(n)

programme.title: Herbie Rides Again
programme.desc: The intrepid Volkswagen Beetle with a mind of his own is living in the care of a kindly widow, his racing career now behind him. He helps quash the plans of a greedy firm of property developers and keep his elderly owner from losing her beloved home. Disney comedy sequel to The Love Bug, starring Helen Hayes, Stefanie Powers, Keenan Wynn and John McIntire.(n)

programme.title: Megamind
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap in his life, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty Halls continues his research when he sets out on a mission with the Irish Air Corps to observe whales from above, before being called out to rescue a stranded basking shark. Taking time off to take part in a race on a traditional sailing boat, Monty has a close shave when the rigging of his vessel becomes entangled with that of another craft.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a bungalow in Surrey, a one-bedroom flat in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, and an Edwardian water tower in Maidstone, Kent, which is to be transformed into a home. They then meet the new owners to discuss their plans for the properties, and discover how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Nigel and Adam's Farm Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigel Slater cooks fresh versions of supermarket favourites using produce grown by Adam Henson on a Cotswolds farm.(n)

programme.title: Becoming Jane
programme.desc: A young Jane Austen's parents are intent on finding her a wealthy husband, but she remains determined to marry for love. Before long, a dashing but penniless lawyer catches the future novelist's eye, but any suggestion of romance meets with distinct disapproval from their families. Romantic period drama, with Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy, Julie Walters, Maggie Smith and Ian Richardson in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: My Friend Jane
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on the lives of Jane Austen super-fans, who read, live and breathe all-things Regency. While Austen's works are often considered genteel romances, they are often shot through with acid-sharp wit, social commentary, and a hint of biography, with certain elements from her famous novels more than mirroring aspects of Jane's own life. Here, the self-professed `Janeites' share their thoughts on why they have fallen in love with Austen's genteel narratives, and explain what the work of a vicar's daughter from Hampshire who died 200 years ago means to them.(n)

programme.title: Jane Austen: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley embarks on a road trip across England to take in some of the places Jane Austen lived in and visited during her lifetime. She aims to demonstrate how Jane's personal experiences influenced the central themes of home and property in her novels, and makes use of detective-work to recreate some of the most important locations that no longer stand. She begins in Stoneleigh Abbey, Warwickshire, retracing a journey that marked one of the many times the Austens veered wildly between wealth and genteel poverty - mirroring the Dashwoods of Sense and Sensibility. Lucy also travels from Jane's birthplace in Steventon, Hampshire, to her brother's grand estate at Godmersham Park - the inspiration for Darcy's Pemberley in Pride and Prejudice, along with Lyme Regis, Bath and Southampton.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: New series. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions once again as the academic quiz returns for its 24th series since the revival of the show in 1994. The opening match of the first round sees the University of Edinburgh and Ulster University battle it out for a place in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits a floral paradise outside of Dublin and discovers how Jimi Blake fills his garden with flora for free. Elsewhere, Nicky Bailey demonstrates how to transform a bland patio into a space that looks incredible at twilight, and Mark Lane travels to Oldham to visit the newly opened Maggie's Centre.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Tudor Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners relive the world of historical sweets, making treats that have not been tasted in centuries from original recipes. The first episode focuses on the Tudor era, where the team makes candied roses and roots, sugar plates and goblets and a model banqueting house, while historians Annie Gray and Emma Dabiri reveal how sweets were a sign of wealth, but were made possible through the slave trade.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: New series. Katie Derham returns with the weekly magazine show, which offers a round-up of highlights from across the annual BBC Proms season. In this first edition, she reviews the opening week of Proms 2017, with help from a selection of guests. Among the performances appraised tonight are a rendition of Elgar's Second Symphony, conducted by Daniel Barenboim, and a selection of memorable music from the movies, courtesy of John Williams.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents highlights of the third day of the prestigious event, which takes place at Royal Birkdale Golf Club in Southport. The players to have made the cut will have been attempting to move themselves into contention for the Claret Jug with a strong round today, as they aim to succeed 2016 champion Henrik Stenson. Commentary by Peter Allis, Ken Brown and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: Performance Live
programme.sub-title: Performance Live: Why It's Kicking Off Everywhere.
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark presents a live broadcast of former economics editor of Channel 4 News and BBC's Newsnight Paul Mason's `popular protest' performance, which has been playing at the Young Vic since late March. In his production, which is based on his 2012 book of the same name, Mason outlines to audiences his very personal account of how the world progressed from the optimism of the Arab Spring and the Occupy Movement to the election of Donald Trump as President of the United States of America. Khalid Abdalla, Sirine Saba and Lara Sawalha also star.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Sue Perkins, Romesh Ranganathan, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the irreverent quiz show. This time, he visits the menagerie for a look at some animals that start with the letter M. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Cosmopolis
programme.desc: A billionaire driven across Manhattan in a limousine discovers that an unexpected development in the stock market is poised to destroy his financial empire. As his fortune crumbles before his eyes, the real world starts to infringe on his sheltered existence through a series of strange encounters. David Cronenberg's drama, starring Robert Pattinson, Juliette Binoche and Paul Giamatti.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Andy Peebles introduce performances by the Specials, Captain Sensible, Siouxsie and the Banshees, Madonna, the Thompson Twins and Lionel Richie. First shown March 29 1984.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Winner of five Academy Awards, 22 Grammy Awards and seven Baftas, John Williams is among the greatest of film composers. In celebration of his 85th birthday, Keith Lockhart - a long-time colleague of Williams at the Boston Pops Orchestra - conducts the BBC Concert Orchestra in an evening featuring music from Jaws, Superman, Star Wars, The BFG, War Horse, Munich and Goodbye Mr Chips, as well as some lesser-known gems. Presented by Katie Derham. Broadcast yesterday evening on BBC Radio 3.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The Georgia-born, London-based comedian goes on a road trip to explore the American South through its songs both past and present, beginning with the music of Kentucky and Tennessee. He examines the disturbing tradition of blackface minstrels, and visits Dollywood theme park, a slave plantation, the home of country music in Nashville, a moonshine distillery in Gatlinburg and a string-band festival in Mount Air. Featuring contributions by Dolly Parton, the Handsome Family and Del McCoury.(n)

programme.title: Sisters in Country: Dolly, Linda and Emmylou
programme.desc: How Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harris's careers took off in the 1970s with very distinct takes on country music, before they came together to collaborate on a successful album in 1987. The artists talk about uniting as harmony singers, focusing on how their alliance made them pioneers in bringing different music worlds together and raising the game for women in the country tradition.(n)

programme.title: Country Queens at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive performances by female country-music stars from a variety of BBC studio shows. Featured acts include Bobbie Gentry, Anne Murray, Emmylou Harris, Taylor Swift, Crystal Gayle, Tammy Wynette, Billie Jo Spears, and Lucinda Williams with Mary Chapin Carpenter.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Andy Peebles introduce performances by the Specials, Captain Sensible, Siouxsie and the Banshees, Madonna, the Thompson Twins and Lionel Richie. First shown March 29 1984.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The Georgia-born, London-based comedian goes on a road trip to explore the American South through its songs both past and present, beginning with the music of Kentucky and Tennessee. programme.title: Sisters in Country: Dolly, Linda and Emmylou
programme.desc: How Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harris's careers took off in the 1970s with very distinct takes on country music, before they came together to collaborate on a successful album in 1987. The artists talk about uniting as harmony singers, focusing on how their alliance made them pioneers in bringing different music worlds together and raising the game for women in the country tradition.(n)

programme.title: Forest, Field & Sky: Art Out of Nature
programme.desc: James Fox journeys through six different landscapes across Britain, meeting artists whose work explores the human relationship with the natural world, from Andy Goldsworthy's stone sculptures to James Turrell's extraordinary Skyspaces.(n)

programme.title: The Last Seabird Summer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adam Nicolson catches up with the seabirds of the Shiants in July, and the colonies seem to be thriving. The puffings guillemots and razorbills are bringing in bill-fuls of fish to feed their chicks, but he discovers this scene is not a common one. The sea is failing to provide the birds with the food they need to survive, and in Scotland alone, an estimated 40 per cent of seabirds have been lost. Some olonies in Iceland are reported to have been wiped out, and Adam speaks to puffin hunters to discover how they have responded to this problem. Plus, with the help of expert ornithologists and marine scientists, he gains an insight into the global forces driving the crisis.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Juan finds a phone number in his office that hints at his own sordid past, and Alicia resigns from the bench until her niece is located. Spanish thriller, with Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Doubts are raised about Juan's amnesia, and a lead found at the scene of the accident brings him into contact with his father-in-law. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)
