programme.desc: Part two of two. The duo try to split up Jack and Stuart when they receive a higher offer on the apartment. Karen jeopardises her budding relationship with Lyle by telling him to discipline his unruly daughter. John Cleese and Minnie Driver guest star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray becomes envious of Robert's good looks and decides the time has come to get a head-to-toe makeover, complete with fake tan. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra learns the second-hand car she bought from Marie and Frank was once the scene of an amorous encounter for a teenage Ray - and promptly decides she does not want it any more. Patricia Heaton and Ray Romano star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A journalist devotes a newspaper column to criticising Frasier, who responds in kind, triggering off a full-scale feud between the pair. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin begins spying on a neighbour through his new telescope and eventually strikes up an acquaintance, much to the delight of Frasier, who does his best to encourage their relationship. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Horrified to learn he has unwittingly invested in a forged painting, Frasier considers his options - and decides to exact a suitable revenge on the dealers who sold it to him. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of £60,000, Sara Damergi scours the Canary island of Fuerteventura for five perfect lock-up-and-leave properties for a couple from Hull.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three rival couples in Essex and East London compete in the dinner-party challenge, beginning with Spencer and Sara's simple, Jewish feast. Reserved pair Lauren and Jack prepare a sophisticated menu reflecting the hosts' heritage in South Africa and Burma. For the final dinner, Paul and Ed opt for a flavourful fare that proves a bit much for those with a fondness for plainer food, and with the contest over, the competitors anxiously wait to discover which party was considered the best.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with naturalist Chris Packham joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible. However, only one of them can leave with each day's prize fund.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Derbyshire pair Sara and Paul find a holiday home in the Murcia region of Spain on a budget of £38,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the contest arrives, and while Amanda Lucia-Charley and Alan Talbot receive harsh criticism of their breakfast, Mark and Jean Lee's decor receives scathing reviews.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: Michele Wibowo is commissioned by a publishing company to create a cake that looks identical to a set of four legal volumes - all the way down to the leather binding and gold leaf inscriptions. In Lancaster, Molly Robbins embarks on a cake designed to be the same shape - and size - of a Shetland pony, while wedding cake specialist Suzanne Thorp is tasked with a cake over 2ft tall featuring 250 hand-crafted sugar flowers.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A corporation buys Springfield Elementary School so it can secretly use the pupils as guinea pigs to test a new range of toys - but Lisa is not fooled and sets out to stop the businessmen. With the guest voices of Tim Robbins, Joe Mantegna and Gary Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren gets a threatening text, Sienna is rushed to hospital, and Hunter covers a shift at The Dog and sees the real Mac. Elsewhere, Prince surprises Lily with a present.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Eight.
programme.desc: Arthur Williams, Ade Adepitan and Lee McKenzie present coverage of day eight of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. A total of 16 finals are scheduled to take place tonight, with track events including the men's T36 400m and T12 200m, as well as the women's T38 400m, while the men's T37 long jump and F53 shot put, and the women's F55 discus and T12 Long Jump, are among the field events to be concluded. With expert analysis from Stef Reid, Danny Crates and Will Bayley.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe bring viewers up to date on the highs and lows from the World Para Athletics Championships, taking place in London. In this edition, the hosts are joined by Paralympic athletes Ellie Simmonds, Hannah Cockroft, Jonnie Peacock and Liam Malone.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. programme.title: 20 Moments
programme.desc: The countdown of memorable moments from the comedy scene draws to a close, with examples from both sides of the Atlantic. Highlighted are the launches of the raucous 1980s student sitcom The Young Ones and the satirical puppet show Spitting Image, the controversy surrounding Monty Python's Life of Brian, and the much deplored `Sachsgate' scandal of 2008, which saw the tide of public opinion turn against popular BBC presenters Russell Brand and Jonathan Ross after they played an ill-conceived prank on Fawlty Towers star Andrew Sachs live on air on Radio 2. The show also highlights more poignant moments, including Joan Rivers' trail-blazing debut on The Tonight Show back in 1965, and Tommy Cooper's death while live on stage in 1985. Featuring David Baddiel, Keith Allen, Jim Davidson, Jenny Eclair and Nina Wadia.(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: The lives of a working-class American, a French journalist and a London schoolboy intersect when their collective grief leads them on a journey to discover the truth about the afterlife(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman was possibly the strangest comedian America has ever seen. He'd take the audience, in pre-booked coaches, off for milk and cookies. He took up wrestling women to prove men's superiority. He could be the world's worst singer or a weird foreigner (a persona he was to take to the comedy hit Taxi ). And he died aged 35 from cancer. Milos Forman's bio-pic stars Jim Carrey in the lead role, with a stellar cast including Danny De Vito as his manager, Courtney Love as his girlfriend and Paul Giamatti as his friend and collaborator in the extraordinary story of an extraordinary man who pushed comedy to its limits(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: Sci-fi drama about a group of space travellers who are forced to land on a foreign planet, where their attempts to escape are hindered by underground mutants bent on a deadly feeding frenzy. With the planet basking in permanent sunlight, the group feel safe in the knowledge that the monsters can only survive in the dark. But a rare total eclipse is imminent, and so a dark battle between man and beast begins(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: The team behind the Scream trilogy, director Wes Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson, present another entry in the teen-horror genre with Cursed. Starring Christina Ricci and Jesse Eisenberg, the film tells the story of two siblings who have to battle a werewolf that has been wreaking havoc on their neighbors, just as they learn that they might be marked with "the sign of the beast," and may become werewolves themselves. Along with Shannon Elizabeth and Judy Greer, Cursed also co-stars Dawson Creek alumnus Joshua Jackson, as well as R&B star Mya(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Nerve-jangling sci-fi horror. After answering a distress signal from a long-dead planet, the crew of a deep-space freighter returning to Earth unwittingly bring aboard a murderous life form that goes on a gruesome rampage. A masterpiece of suspense - taking a B-movie plot and adding benchmark production values, including Swiss surrealist H R Giger's nightmarish designs - the film won an Oscar for its startling visual effects(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: This rip-roaring remake of the 1965 adventure classic soars thanks to stunning aerial photography and fantastic special effects. Dennis Quaid plays a pilot whose plane crashes in the Gobi Desert, where he and his crew try to reconstruct their craft and fly it to safety. The film marks the directorial debut of John Moore. Tyrese Gibson, Miranda Otto, Giovanni Ribisi, Tony Curran, Kirk Jones (a.k.a. Sticky Fingaz), Hugh Laurie, Scott Michael Campbell, Jared Padalecki, Kevork Malikyan(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A a meek univeristy student living on her own in New York City meets Brooke, her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: In this exhilarating drama based on true events, legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Puerto Rican drug dealer Carlito Brigante (Al Pacino) obtains his parole after doing only five years of his 30-year sentence. Hoping to live honestly and make some money, he accepts to run a nightclub. Yet he meets face to face with his past when old friends drag him back into violence and illegal business. Sean Penn delivers an outstanding performance as David Kleinfeld, the cocaine addicted corrupt lawyer(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: A vulgar but vibrant detective spoof in which a Los Angeles private eye tries to find the link between a missing girl, the murder of a heavy-metal star and the electrocution of a friend. Starring controversial stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Sigourney Weaver returns from the dead as Ellen Ripley, for the fourth instalment of the hugely successful Alien saga. Cloned by a fanatic geneticist in order to retrieve the alien baby inside her, Ripley re-awakens to find mutant DNA in her blood. With the help of a group of bandits who have smuggled on board the ship, including Winona Ryder as Call, Ripley must do battle against the forces of evil once more. However, with the alien actually inside her, Ripley finds she must face up to the demons within herself as well as facing old enemies(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Marvel Comics adventures of Peter Parker, a nerdy high-school student who is transformed into a web-spinning vigilante(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner make a sizzling duo in this dark and sexy adaptation of the Marvel comic. Affleck plays the blind lawyer-turned-superhero who takes on Kingpin and his rogues' gallery of villains to avenge the death of his father. Garner heats things up as the leather-clad Elektra, the daughter of a slain shipping tycoon who is out for some payback of her own(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Seeking a very personal and mysterious revenge against Detective John McClane, a malevolent genius named Simon is forcing the heroic cop to play a deadly game. The stakes: New York City itself. The game begins when a phone call from Simon sends McClane to Harlem, where he unexpectedly forms an alliance with the very unwilling Zeus Carver. McClane and Zeus soon find themselves careening across the Big Apple, pursuing the deadly Simon, who's always one step ahead of them(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Al Pacino delivers an explosive performance as a burnt-out American football coach who finds himself under pressure when the team's owner tries to rejuvenate the losing team(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: In this film, based on a true story, Sonny bursts into a crowded Brooklyn bank, gun in hand. His carefully planned robbery scheme will ostensibly finance a sex-change operation for his transvestite lover, but this and every other aspect of the crime goes horribly awry(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Conclusion of tonight's film(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: Rowdy friends throw a stag party for a groom-to-be, whose future bride infiltrates the bash to test his fidelity. Meanwhile, her rich daddy does his best to stop the wedding(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My First Step. Dr Cox's principled opposition to the big drugs companies is tested to the limit by a seductive pharmaceutical sales rep (guest star Heather Locklear) who is particularly interested in him. Meanwhile, JD and Elliot disagree on the best course of action for a critical patient, and Turk tries to talk Carla into taking her career to the next level(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Fruit Cups. Rivalry for Cox's affection pits his new flame, Julie (Heather Locklear), against his ex-wife, who's in a delicate physical and emotional state. Jordan: Christa Miller Lawrence. Dr. Reid: Lane Davies. Elliot: Sarah Chalke. Turk: Donald Faison(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Lucky Day. Elliot faces a lawsuit from an irate, recovering patient (Alan Ruck) who was originally told by her that he had just a short time to live; J.D. and Cox treat two new patients who have identical, complicated symptoms. John Ritter and David Copperfield have cameos. Jordan: Christa Miller Lawrence(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Monster. Carla is concerned that Turk isn't as romantic as he used to be, Dr Cox lets his pregnant ex-wife Jordan move in with him, and cash-strapped Elliot reluctantly agrees to share accommodation with JD and Turk. JD worries that the hospital has sapped him of his sex drive when his date with the gift-shop girl proves fruitless, but his fears are allayed when he returns home to Elliot(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Sex Buddy. Elliot and J.D. start sleeping together again when she moves in with him temporarily - uh-oh. Turk tries to help out Elliot with her workload, but his efforts backfire(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My New Old Friend. J.D. and Elliot are no longer sex buddies, and J.D. struggles with just being a friend. Dr. Cox has to deal with a hypochondriac patient, and Dr. Kelso teaches Turk a lesson(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The First Date. Growing up is bad enough, without having to do it in '70s America. Follow a group of friends as they do battle with hormones, parents and dodgy fashion(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Pill. Jackie thinks she's pregnant, news that reverberates throughout the gang---and to some of their parents. Gary Owens has a cameo. Pharmacist: Mark Ankeny(n)

programme.desc: Career Day. It is career day, meaning that all the kids must spend 24 hours working for their parents(n)

programme.desc: Prom Night. Eric decides to rent a motel room for prom night(n)

programme.desc: A New Hope. Hyde meets a girl who seems just like himself. She tries to convince him to come to New York with her(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Water Tower. Eric's parents think he shows symptoms of being on drugs, but his demeanor is really an aftershock from seeing them having sex; Kelso blames Hyde for an injury incurred during a prank(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: When America's number one NASCAR speed-demon is issued a direct challenge from a gay, French Formula One racer with a hunger for the top spot and a mean talent for tight-cornering, the race is on to become the number one man in all of NASCAR in a full throttle comedy starring Will Ferrell and directed by Anchorman cohort Adam McKay. Ricky Bobby (Ferrell) is a national hero with a "smokin' hot" trophy wife, pair of borderline-abusively precocious sons, and an endless line of endorsement deals filling his mansion with toys and driveway with sports cars and Hummers. His racing partner and lifelong friend Cal Naughton, Jr. (John C. Reilly), never fails to provide him with a hand on the racetrack, frequently performing their trademark "slingshot" maneuver to shoot Ricky into first place, leaving Cal in second. While the public loves these buddies (popularly known by the meaningless childhood nicknames they find so exceedingly cool: "Shake and Bake"), a wedge comes between the two, as Ricky Bobby's longstanding winning-streak is broken by flamboyand French Formula One driver Jean Girard (Sacha Baron Cohen), robbing Ricky of everything in an instant as the trauma leaves him unable to drive. Ricky's wife takes his fortunes while Cal takes his wife, and now he's back with his mother (Jane Lynch) and long-estranged father (Gary Cole). Things look bad for Ricky, but his father was once a race car driver himself, and now with the help of a training montage, a live cougar, and the courage to drive without his gleaming white Wonder Bread endorsement, Ricky might be ready to face the track again(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedian concludes her epic journey along the Southeast Asian river as she follows it through China's wildest and most spectacular valleys on her way to the Mekong's source in the Himalayas. With the Chinese economic boom sweeping through these remote regions, Sue reveals how ancient ways of life are changing and asks what China will save of its past. At the end of her 3,000-mile quest, she joins a group of nuns high on the Tibetan Plateau as they make an offering to the gods at the point where the Mekong's waters first filter into the lives of people.(n)

programme.title: Resurrection Science
programme.desc: Documentary exploring efforts to sequence the DNA of extinct species including the woolly mammoth and Neanderthal man.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads for the coast of Kenya, where he encounters a large wahoo fish while searching for dorado, before going back to basics to learn a traditional fishing technique that consists of just lines and bare hands. He also visits Lake Victoria, where an unusual method is employed to catch whitebait.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: Conclusion. The migration reaches Kenya's Masai Mara, where the river presents the strongest challenge yet for the calves. Cameras reveal how crocodiles and hippos are preying on stragglers, while the rough waters threaten to sweep the animals away.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedian concludes her epic journey along the Southeast Asian river as she follows it through China's wildest and most spectacular valleys on her way to the Mekong's source in the Himalayas. programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Planet Oil
programme.sub-title: Planet Oil: The Treasure That Conquered the World.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart reveals that huge technological advances are helping extend the life of existing oil and gas fields, while new sources such as shale gas and tar sands will provide for the hydrocarbon age well into the 21st century. He examines whether continuing to extract oil risks catastrophic climate change, and looks at alternative energy supplies that could help make the transition to a low-carbon future.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Examining the behaviour of some of the world's most intelligent creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Marven's Venom Hunters
programme.desc: The naturalist travels the globe to uncover the life-saving properties of reptile venom as increasing numbers of creatures come under the microscope in the quest to find cures and preventative medicines for a range of human ailments. From the copperhead snake in northern Florida to the eastern brown in Australia, he discovers how the chemicals contained in their venom can help cure life-threatening conditions if harnessed in the right way.(n)

programme.title: China's 10 Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The wildlife presenter, author and ornithologist travels to the Far East for a closer look at China's deadliest snakes.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the rainforest on the tropical island of New Guinea, where cameraman Gordon Buchanan enlists the aid of local tribespeople to help him film birds of paradise performing their unusual courtship ritual. George McGavin has to contend with a giant crocodile, and Steve Backshall discovers a hidden network of caves never previously seen by humans.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the team's explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial.(n)

programme.desc: Three cops desperately team together to try to prevent yet another murdered body being added to the marshes outside of an insular Texan town(n)

programme.title: I Still Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: A year after the original tragedy, Julie James is in college trying to piece her life back together. When her roommate, Karla, wins a trip for four to a tropical island, everything seems to be fine. That changes during a seemingly harmless karaoke session, however, when instead of lyrics a menacing message appears on the teleprompter to return the horror to Julie's life..(n)

programme.title: The Ringer
programme.desc: A hilarious and heartwarming comedy about a loser with money problems who pretends to be a mentally challenged athlete to rig the Special Olympics(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: From Mike Judge, the creator of "Beavis and Butt-head" and "King of the Hill," comes this outrageous laughathon about a U.S. soldier (Luke Wilson) who gets involved in an experiment and awakens 500 years later in a world filled with dumb people, making him the smartest man on the planet. Maya Rudolph, Dax Shepard, Terry Alan Crews, David Herman, Michael McCafferty, Thomas Haden Church. Judge directed and co-wrote the script with Etan Cohen(n)

programme.desc: Comedy about a divorced voice-over actor who will try anything to get his family back - even disguising himself as their new housekeeper Mrs Doubtfire. programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: Sebastian Caine is a brilliant yet arrogant scientist working on a top secret mission for the U.S. government to unlock the secret to human invisibility. After creating a serum that induces invisibility in laboratory animals, he disobeys Pentagon orders by trying the serum on himself(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Kevin Costner slides into his third baseball-themed film, a well-crafted sentimental voyage which nicely blends romantic drama with intense on-field action. Costner plays aging Detroit Tigers hurler Billy Chapel, who takes the mound for the final game of the season---and maybe his career. As he strives to pitch a perfect game, Chapel reminisces about a whirlwind romance. Kelly Preston(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Two kids discover an old board game and when they start playing it they free a man named Alan, who has spent years trapped inside the game since playing it at age 12. Alan's only hope for freedom involves finishing the dangerous game(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy about a divorced voice-over actor who will try anything to get his family back - even disguising himself as their new housekeeper Mrs Doubtfire. Daniel Hillard is devastated when his ex-wife Miranda is awarded custody of the children, allowing him to see them only on Saturdays. Miranda takes him on as a housekeeper, thinking he is an eccentric Scottish matron, and everyone is happy - until Miranda's new beau Stu reappears(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: John Candy, Rick Moranis, Bill Pullman and Dom DeLuise rocket into orbit in this side-splitting Mel Brooks excursion where good and evil forces grapple in an out-of-this-world galaxy(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the US president asks his old gamer pals to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: In this lively adolescent-oriented musical, a city kid attempts to adapt to life in an ultra-conservative backwater Midwestern town. Once there, he ends up leading the repressed teenagers into a rebellion against the town fathers, who have outlawed rock & roll and dancing(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Anarchic, nihilistic satire on modern life in which an office worker who feels emotionally deadened by his consumerist lifestyle has a chance encounter with a charismatic man. Finding that they are kindred spirits, the two men start up a no-holds-barred bare-knuckle fighting club, with the aim of making its members feel 'alive' once again(n)

programme.title: State Property 2
programme.desc: Hip-hop entrepreneur Damon Dash directs and costars in this explosive, action-packed gangsta saga. Real-life rapper Beanie Sigel stars as a Philly drug kingpin who plots to maintain control of his empire while he's in prison. Victor N.O.R.E. Santiago, Michael Bentt, Kenneth Johnson(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: For 60 years, a Tibetan monk has protected an ancient scroll which gives its owner immortality and incredible power. With a new generation of Nazis determined to snatch the scroll, the monk recruits a young pickpocket to help defeat evil(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: In the 23rd century, a strange woman, and a New York cabbie, could save the world from destruction(n)

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks 2: Destination London
programme.desc: Frankie Muniz's mini James Bond races to stop a rogue CIA man's crazy plot. Adventure with cool gadgets and Hannah 'S-Club' Spearitt(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland
programme.desc: A teen finds a pin that sends her to a futuristic world, and goes on an trip through time and space to save the Earth(n)

programme.title: Beer for My Horses
programme.desc: Bill Racklin is a deputy sheriff in Greer County Oklahoma, the crystal meth capital of the region. His girlfriend leaves him, but things look up when his high-school sweetheart, Annie, returns home. On a stakeout, Rack and two other deputies arrest four men stealing fertilizer to make crystal meth; one of the four is the brother of a notorious Mexican drug dealer. The drug lord arranges Annie's kidnapping and holds her to ransom his brother(n)

programme.title: The Condemned 2
programme.desc: A bounty hunter must fight to stay alive as he plays a deadly game, created by a wealthy and evil mastermind, in which he must hunt down his opponents before they are able kill him(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Office.
programme.desc: A parking attendant is mistakenly killed by an assailant whose real target was financial analyst Warren Kemp. Adrian goes undercover in Kemp's firm to solve the baffling crime, and finds that he might be dealing with an insider-trading scam. Guest starring Eddie McClintock (Warehouse 13).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI team attends the scene of a murder in Carson Springs - a small town divided by two rival gangs. A blood trail next to the victim leads to another mystery when Rigsby finds his father Steve in a nearby shack with a bullet in his heart. He also seems unable, or unwilling, to talk as his son and Lisbon try unsuccessfully to get information from him. Guest starring William Forsythe (Boardwalk Empire, The Rock).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the 100th episode of the crime drama, a series of flashbacks reveals how Patrick Jane came to the CBI with the hope of gaining access to the Red John case files, having lost his wife and daughter the previous year at the hands of the serial killer. After provoking an agent into attacking him, Jane threatens to sue unless he is allowed to stick around, and his first case with the bureau is to solve the murder of a judge's son, whose body was found next to his car on a remote road. Simon Baker stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A security guard is found murdered in an upmarket neighbourhood and the CBI agents investigate, leading them to believe a wealthy couple have been kidnapped - but events take an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Jane continues to look into Lorelei Martins' disappearance from the Sacramento County Jail. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI team looks into the death of Cassie Flood, a journalist whose car careered off a winding mountain road. It looks like an accident at first, but Jane soon realises that foul play was involved and the investigation leads to billionaire philanthropist Tommy Volker - and Lisbon and Jane uncover evidence that Cassie was about to blow the whistle on his shady dealings. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick (Lost).(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team face a race against time to find a missing eight-year-old girl who disappeared on her way home from school, and Gabriel puts his career in jeopardy when he takes drastic action to solve the case.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The detectives find themselves in the middle of a dramatic case when a man claims to have murdered seven people, but refuses to identify himself. Meanwhile, Brenda goes house-hunting with Fritz. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a personal trainer who was killed in the car park of a restaurant, but the only witness is a frightened valet with OCD. Meanwhile, the department has to complete anti-terrorism training to receive funding from the government. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Tensions run high after two Latino gang members are murdered, and the department must solve the crime before the situation develops into a gang war. Brenda has a health scare when she finally visits her doctor. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the cause of a hit-and-run incident in which a Petty Officer has been killed. Meanwhile, Gibbs works to clear a Navy Hospital Corpsman who has been indicted for illegally providing medical aid to victims of the crash, despite the injured insisting her techniques helped save their lives. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress email server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This `lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late dad taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The bodies of five people, all of whom are identified as being from the US Navy, are found on the floor of a diner, and all are connected to a suspicious tax firm that specialises in helping people who are in arrears. When further killings are linked to the business, the team realises the crime seem to be copycats of previous cases. Meanwhile, two of Gibbs' ex-wives appear at the location with something important to discuss with the agent. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends Quinn and Bishop to Philadelphia to investigate when the murder of a petty officer is linked to the disappearance of an MI6 agent.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The wealthy parents of a murdered socialite attempt to hire Bull to help prosecute their daughter's working-class fiance for the crime, but he chooses to help the defendant instead.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Fast Times at Buddy Cianci Jr High.
programme.desc: Chris falls in love with new teacher Mrs Lockhart - who takes advantage of his naive infatuation by luring him into a scheme to kill her unsuspecting husband. Meanwhile, Brian takes a job as a substitute teacher and is put in charge of a remedial class. With the guest voice of Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mort and Quagmire both notch up notable achievements, making Peter feel he ought to do something he can be proud of. He decides to set the world record for swallowing coins - but does not take into account the dangers of nickel poisoning.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is asked to persuade the dictator of Isla Island to sign a treaty to secure a promotion at work. However, he ends up accidentally killing the man, and enlists Roger to take his place.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The family takes Hayley on a trip to look at colleges and leaves Steve home alone. He and his friends find what they think is a video game in Stan's study - but it turns out to be a CIA drone.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stories inspired by viewers' letters, featuring a look at the world from Stewie's point of view and a British version of the Griffins. Peter also gains the power to turn everyone in Quahog into Robin Williams by touching them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: When Stan gets sick of Roger bragging about his own importance he challenges him to prove it. Believing himself to be `The Decider' with the fate of the world resting in his hands, Roger is dismayed to discover he is nothing more than a crash test dummy.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan reveals his next-door neighbour is gay during a conversation with the man's father, and tries to find a way to make amends for his blunder. Meanwhile, Roger buys alcohol for Steve and his friends.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: When You Wish Upon a Weinstein.
programme.desc: A Jewish accountant helps the Griffins resolve a financial crisis, prompting a grateful Peter to try to convert Chris to Judaism. However, plans for a quick bar mitzvah in Las Vegas are soon foiled.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter goes on a second honeymoon with Lois in an effort to put the spark back into their marriage, and tries to get an upgrade on their hotel suite by impersonating Mel Gibson. Meanwhile, Chris gets into trouble for having alcohol at a school dance - despite protesting it was not his.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan goes out with some co-workers, but their night gets completely out of control when bodies pile up in the boot of Dick's car. Meanwhile, Roger and Hayley try to find out which of them is better looking. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve is selected to sing the national anthem at a Veterans Day celebration, but Stan is convinced he is not ready to undertake such a prestigious task, and decides he will only be capable of performing with feeling once he has experienced war first-hand.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police investigate claims of a domestic attack and two brothers are questioned about a fight.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in Texas use a Taser to break up a bar fight, and officers in Florida are forced to step in when a dispute over a barking dog escalates into an armed stand-off.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy Lieutenant who has been murdered while on his way to a meeting with the President, and must ascertain whether the killing was part of a recent spate of muggings in the area - or a targeted hit to keep information secret. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky works on a case involving his estranged childhood best friend, travelling to London with Special Agent Bishop to interview his pal's family and co-workers. While away, the detective reflects on his own past choices, and examines how they have affected his present life. Alice Krige guest stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team is assigned to a joint terrorism task force by the Secretary when a Moscow-born scientist who it is believed may have been targeted by the Russians for selling state secrets, is found dead. The trail appears to lead to a friend of Sofia's, another scientist who worked for Russia and who may have succumbed to professional jealousy. However, when she too is found dead, the team discovers the hallmarks of Sergei Mishnev, the terrorist who nearly killed Gibbs. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While on a joint Coast Guard and NCIS training exercise at sea with Agent Borin, Gibbs spots a dead man overboard, who is found to be a missing member of the crew of a nearby vessel. However, when the agent boards the ship for questioning, he realises it has been commandeered by pirates. Naval drama, starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy commander's wife, determining whether it is linked to her role as a therapist, or an act of terrorism since her husband's name has appeared on a Jihadist's target list. Elsewhere, the group discusses Halloween costumes, as well as Tony's recent dating habits. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant is murdered during a `tiger cruise', during which sailors' friends and relatives are invited aboard military vessels to spend the night on their ship.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends Quinn and Bishop to Philadelphia to investigate when the murder of a petty officer is linked to the disappearance of an MI6 agent.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.sub-title: So Long and Thanks for All the Red Snapper.
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of a surfer, Lisbon reconnects with her ex-fiance, whom she has not seen for more than a decade, and Cho questions whether he should be in a relationship with Summer. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney, Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is consumed by memories of his wife and daughter as the eighth anniversary of their deaths arrives. To make matters worse, he is taunted by Red John, the serial killer he blames for their murders, and his lapse in concentration jeopardises Lisbon's latest case - as well as his position within the CBI. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane finds solace in the arms of a woman when his latest efforts to apprehend Red John fail. Lisbon and the team hunt for a murderer after an unidentifiable body is discovered. Crime drama, guest starring Emmanuelle Chriqui (Entourage), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Tensions rise between the CBI and the FBI as they try to cover up the events leading to Jane's unsuccessful takedown of Red John and the death of Wainwright. While Jane tries to find out more about Lorelei's connection to the serial killer, the agencies work together to investigate the murder of a hotel employee. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI investigates the murder of a diamond cutter who was disembowelled with his own tools. After drinking a cup of tea at the victim's house, Jane finds a rabbit that was locked in a cabinet and chases the animal into a neighbour's yard. There, he meets a precocious young girl who claims to be his daughter Charlotte - the same one who was killed along with his wife by Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan finally saves enough money to join the golf club he has worked at for the past 30 summers - only to discover Steve has been given a membership before him. However, everything changes when the CIA officer learns who owns the business. Featuring the voice of Hulk Hogan.(n)

On other fronts, a sleep clinic serves as the setting for a startling revelation, and Paul's cousin Ira (John Pankow) vows to abstain from sex. programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A war begins to brew between man and ape in this sequel to the 2011 hit Rise of the Planet of the Apes. It's been ten years since the Simian Flu wiped out most of humanity, and somewhere deep in the woods outside of San Francisco, Caesar (voice and performance capture by Andy Serkis) and his primate companions have established a thriving village built on the principles of peace and community. Shortly after welcoming a baby brother into the family, Caesar's son Blue Eyes (Nick Thurston) is walking through the forest with his friend Ash (Doc Shaw) when they cross paths with a human named Carver (Kirk Acevedo), who impulsively draws his gun and shoots Ash at the first sign of aggression. As it turns out, Carver is part of a human expedition led by Malcolm (Jason Clarke), who, along with the rest of his crew, races to Carver's side just as Caesar and the rest of the apes answer Blue Eyes' desperate call for help. An enraged Caesar drives the humans away after realizing they are no longer a threat, and decides to dispatch a small crew to follow them rather than yield to the pleas of his aggressive advisor Koba (Toby Kebbell) to launch an all-out attack. Instead, he decides to show the apes' strength by amassing outside of the humans' makeshift community at the base of an unfinished tower, making it unmistakably clear that the two species should remain apart. Meanwhile, the point of the human excursion was to get a dormant dam running again in order to power their community, which will soon be thrust into darkness should they fail to take action. Convinced that he could strike a truce with Caesar that would allow the humans to repair the dam, which is located on the apes' land, Malcolm gets permission from human leader Dreyfus (Gary Oldman) to set out on his mission. Incredibly, thanks to the help of his girlfriend Ellie (Keri Russell), his son Alexander (Kodi Smit-McPhee), and a few other key allies, Malcolm succeeds. Still, his truce with the apes is a fragile one, and just when it seems that the primates and humans have learned to coexist in peace, a shocking act of betrayal threatens to spark a war that will determine the dominant species(n)

programme.title: 30 Minutes or Less
programme.desc: In this wacky action comedy, two criminals kidnap pizza-delivery guy Nick (Jesse Eisenberg) and force him to rob a bank. In desperation, Nick turns to his former best friend Chet (Aziz Ansari) for help getting out of this predicament. Directed by Ruben Fleischer(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: A US Marine unit fighting in the Pacific is ordered to capture Japanese troops so they can be interrogated for information about a new weapons base - but the mission proves even more difficult than expected. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: The Last Sunset
programme.desc: A wanted murderer travels to Mexico to see the now-married love of his life, little realising he is being pursued by a determined sheriff. However, both the outlaw and the lawman end up working for the woman's husband on a cattle drive. Western, starring Rock Hudson, Kirk Douglas, Dorothy Malone and Joseph Cotten.(n)

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: A priest is sent to a South Seas island to replace a drunken missionary, who has been relieved of his duties. Sharing his flight are three convicts being sent to work at a children's leper hospital. The five men must work together to protect the young patients when a volcano erupts, leaving them stranded with no easy way out. Adventure, starring Spencer Tracy, Frank Sinatra and Kerwin Mathews.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk Interview Special
programme.desc: A look at director Christopher Nolan's Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Cillian Murphy and Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: An American youngster goes to live in China with his mother, where he becomes an outsider and falls foul of the local bullies. He receives help from the kindly school caretaker, who turns out to be a kung fu master and offers to train the boy to defend himself. Martial arts drama, with Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta.(n)

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: A retired safe-breaker enjoying the high life in Spain becomes the target of unwanted attention when his psychotic former gangland boss comes looking to enlist his help and expertise for a major bank robbery in London. Crime thriller, starring Ray Winstone, Ben Kingsley, Ian McShane and Amanda Redman.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Thrills
programme.desc: A man who has lost his job keeps his unemployment a secret from his family, but now faces losing their home. While he and a friend drown their sorrows, they are approached by a wealthy couple who offer the duo money if they will carry out a series of bizarre challenges. Comedy thriller, starring Pat Healy and Ethan Embry.(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
programme.desc: A teenager hears the cemetery where her grandfather is buried has been desecrated by grave robbers, so she and her friends go to investigate. However, they soon fall into the clutches of a family of inbred slaughterhouse workers who have taken over a nearby house and plan to kill and eat their captives. Tobe Hooper's horror, starring Marilyn Burns and Gunnar Hansen.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk Interview Special
programme.desc: A look at director Christopher Nolan's Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Cillian Murphy and Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cabby
programme.desc: The neglected wife of a workaholic taxi owner grows increasingly tired of his lack of interest in their marriage. In a ploy to bring him to his senses, she secretly launches a rival cab firm with a driver roster made up of attractive women, who soon tempt his customers away. Comedy, starring Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Kenneth Connor and Charles Hawtrey.(n)

programme.title: Robots
programme.desc: Rodney the robot heads for the city, hoping to find an investor for his latest invention. Instead, he winds up clashing with an evil business mogul intent on stopping a manufacturer from making spare parts needed for ageing robots - so Rodney teams up with assorted rusty rejects to put the matter right. Animated adventure, with the voices of Ewan McGregor, Halle Berry, Robin Williams, Greg Kinnear and Amanda Bynes.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk Interview Special
programme.desc: A look at director Christopher Nolan's Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Cillian Murphy and Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: A scientist working on synthetic skin is horribly disfigured and left for dead by a criminal gang. Now unable to feel pain, he continues his research, creating artificial faces that will last for only a short time. He uses these disguises to aid him in taking revenge on those who mutilated him - while also using a mask of his own face to see the girlfriend who thinks he died. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand.(n)

programme.title: The Counsellor
programme.desc: A lawyer who earns a living representing drug dealers makes a fateful decision to take an active role in their criminal activities. He quickly finds himself out of his depth in a criminal underworld he barely understands, where his actions bring deadly consequences. Ridley Scott's crime thriller, starring Michael Fassbender, Penelope Cruz, Cameron Diaz, Javier Bardem and Brad Pitt.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares barbecue ribs, potato salad and blue cheese coleslaw.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten demonstrates the versatility of pasta, preparing a lasagne, a pesto salad, and a penne and five-cheese special.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American writer Ina Garten creates a lunch box after receiving a gift of herbs from her friend.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals how to create delicious dishes without spending hours at the stove, preparing a chicken pie and split pea soup.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna prepares grilled salmon with balsamic onion glaze, Swiss chard with pine nuts and pan roasted garlic, and for dessert, peach frozen yoghurt and pizelle.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares heirloom tomato salad, corn shrimp fritters with cucumber remoulade, and chicken terrine with ham and onion marmalade at a local winery farm-to-table event.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Fashion designer Pat McDonagh may be a hit on the runways, but her culinary skills are very much out of fashion.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While Ree Drummond's daughter Alex and her friends have a dorm room craft day at college, Ree makes green chili chicken, spicy taco potatoes, layered Mexican salad and key lime pie.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: As the guys are away, Ree Drummond makes a blueberry crumb cake for breakfast, and petite filets with wasabi cilantro cream, lobster mac and cheese and lemony broccolini for dinner.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie brings Mexico to California with a home-based fiesta, including salt-crusted whole snapper fish tacos, fresh sriracha lime corn tortillas and cotija corn on the cob.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie surprises her childhood friend with a curated at-home sushi night, including creamy rock shrimp tempura and classic sushi hand rolls.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: North East chefs Frances Atkins, Paul Welburn and Colin McGurran prepare desserts as they continue in their quest to cook at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day. A mystery Great British Menu veteran assesses them and decides which one of the trio will not be returning for the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs prepare their entire menus for Prue Leith, Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and guest judge Molly Rose, who flew Spitfires for the Air Transport Auxiliary during the Second World War to support the RAF. Only one contender can make it through to represent their region in the national finals and get the chance to cook at a banquet held in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a delicious Tex-Mex tailgate lunch, including a beef taco bar, green chilli queso, chipotle salsa and chilli beans and sugar cookies.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up four of her favourite treats, including pumpkin cinnamon rolls, sticky sweet baklava, white chocolate shortbread cookies and chocolate-dipped strawberries.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam seeks secret eats in Ilulissat and Oqaatsut, Greenland, including off-menu reindeer schnitzel and fried rice that combines Thai and Greenlandic flavours.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam seeks biker-approved secret eats during the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, including a pop-up barbecue pit serving a secret sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: In the Pacific Northwest, Seattle chef Renee Erickson celebrates summer by smoking meats and seafood in wine barrels that have been transformed into smokers.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: At Ned Ludd, an American craft kitchen restaurant in Portland, chef Jason French loves to prepare food in his wood-fired oven so much that he doesn't even have a gas stove.(n)

programme.title: Jamie & Jimmy's Food Fight Club
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty meet a group of brewers as they try to beat the Belgians at their own game by making a better beer, and Gary Barlow visits the duo's seaside cafe for steak and ale pie, before joining them for a ride on a rollercoaster. Jimmy is also on the hunt for sustainable alternatives to fish and chips, serving up squirrel pie, jellyfish cakes and snail scampi.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps first-time restaurant owner Joe, who has run himself into the ground trying to keep Joe Broadway's Billiards & Sports Pub afloat.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Joe and Fran, owners of Geppino's Sicilian Kitchen, hear customer complaints about stolen items, Joe suspects their daughter's boyfriend is to blame.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kristian, owner of Tavern on Main, fears someone on his staff is stealing donations from his restaurant's annual Thanksgiving Food Drive. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners to see if any employees are taking instead of giving.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.sub-title: Rhode Islands: Chowing Gaggers and Stuffies.
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern visits Rhode Island, where the local food is a blend of old traditions and high-tech creations.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine addresses two issues at Pasion Latin Fusion; tension between co-owner Monica and the main investor, and a menu that is leaving customers confused and frustrated.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Tommy, owner of Gigi Restaurant in Philadelphia, suspects that his manager - also his mother - is discriminating against younger customers, so contacts Charles to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Del Rossi's Cheesesteak Co owners Dave and Mike Frank contact the team for help after hearing complaints that their late-night security guard is being rough with customers.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares more tempting recipes, including blueberry coffee cake muffins and gravlax.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a birthday party for a friend's dog.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten hosts a black and white supper, and cooks chicken hash, pain perdu and white truffles.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's daughter Paige and her friend Stanton request Chinese food for their sleepover dinner, so Ree prepares an Asian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her friend Hyacinth are throwing a graduation party for their daughters, and it is going to be the perfect send-off for the graduates.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It is a big day of spring burning on the ranch, so Ree Drummond is preparing a Tex-Mex feast for her crew.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. He begins in Los Angeles, where he departs from the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to sample Mexican dishes away from the bright lights.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Red Decoder.
programme.desc: A full-scale search is organised for a missing piece of Russian decoding equipment - which has mysteriously turned up at Peter's house.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A woman trained to seduce Western spied and discover their secrets has Peter in her sights.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin enters the pub snooker tournament, but is put out when he learns Paul is also a contender. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast November 18, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon decides the centre itself is causing strange behaviour among the staff. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Genuine Racer Please Stand Up?.
programme.desc: Howard becomes ill at ease with his lot in life, and tries to change his appearance so that not even Pearl would recognise him. But he soon discovers that the drawbacks of assuming someone else's identity are greater than the benefits.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Short Introduction to Cooper's Rules.
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duo's carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrel's skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin enters the pub snooker tournament, but is put out when he learns Paul is also a contender. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast November 18, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon decides the centre itself is causing strange behaviour among the staff. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to prise open his wallet and buy a new suit, until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel gives him an incentive. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The day of Shazia's wedding to Amjad finally dawns, but it doesn't get off to a great start when Mrs Khan falls out with her daughter and refuses to attend the ceremony. This leaves Mr Khan to sort out the mess - but in his none-too-subtle attempt to get his wife back on side, he only manages to make matters worse - then the groom goes missing and Mrs Malik makes a startling revelation.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuel's pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Genuine Racer Please Stand Up?.

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuel's pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy wastes money on a stolen statue and Joey tries to claim an incontinence allowance for Grandad. First episode of Carla Lane's comedy, with Jean Boht and Peter Howitt.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: One-off episode. Almost seven years have passed since Baby David's christening, but Jim is still picking his nose and setting the world to rights from his armchair. Nana is now the centre of attention after moving in and Antony is a successful businessman. Denise is pregnant again and sporting fancy hair extensions, while Cheryl is still trying to lose weight and looking for love. Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ricky Tomlinson star.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes tries to make friends with Dermot's mother-in-law Hillary ahead of the baby's birth, and suggests they go out to dinner together. However, the evening comes to an abrupt end for the two feuding matriarchs when expectant mum Maria goes into labour, and the Browns are forced to rush her to hospital. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is disappointed to discover she is not invited to Maria's hen party because of her age, and decides to gatecrash the event, only to end up at the wrong venue. She then tries to impress the bride-to-be's mother during a dinner date, but is so nervous she turns to drink, and the evening descends into chaos. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddie's TV is repossessed, giving them ample opportunity to amuse themselves with a series of violent tit-for-tat assaults thinly disguised as games. Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddie's nocturnal peace is disturbed by a violent encounter with a burglar - resulting in the intruder's sack of loot falling into their sticky hands. Paul Bradley guests, with Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Famous publisher Hamilton Cork visits the zoo and Howard sees an opportunity to get the novel he has spent his life writing into print - but the esteemed guest is more interested in Vince's story about a character called Charlie. Meanwhile, Bob comes up with a new breeding programme for the pandas.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Vince's dreams of musical stardom come true when Johnny Two Hats and the Electro Girls ask him to join their new band Kraftwork Orange, leading to a parting of the ways with all that is familiar - including Howard. Comedy, with Noel Fielding and Julian Barratt.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Daisy unwittingly jeopardises Tim's chances of finding fame as a comic-strip artist, and Brian decides the time has come to tell his mother the truth about his own career. Meanwhile, Marsha resolves to get into shape. Guest starring Olivia Williams (The Sixth Sense).(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Tim and Daisy set off for a night on the town, but it is not long before they run into an old enemy - as well as a few new ones. Meanwhile, Mike and Brian are left to look after Colin, only to discover dog-sitting is harder than they had imagined. Comedy, starring Simon Pegg and Jessica Stevenson, with Peter Serafinowicz.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: A woman's collection of dresses is stolen, only for Eddie Izzard and Dani Behr to turn up in a new selection of frocks, and Armando posts reviews of his neighbours' lives outside their houses.(n)

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: Vic invites Bob's ex-wife Erika over as a surprise for his birthday, not realising she is intent on killing her former husband. The housemates decide to tell her that Bob is dead and attempt to safely steer Erika back to Norway without her finding out the truth, but she turns out to be a lot more fun than any of them had anticipated. Comedy, guest starring Sofia Ledarp.(n)
