programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. For their budget of £220,000 they're after a place to escape the British winters, as close to the amazing beaches of the Gulf of Mexico as possible. Jonnie shows them how far their budget will stretch in this highly desirable corner of the US.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Labrador is rushed to Fitzpatrick's unable to stand, and although Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tells the family that surgery is not an option, his team devises an alternative care plan. The vets also treat a bichon frise suffering chronic elbow pain, and a leonberger has a bone tumour removed from its leg after being diagnosed with cancer.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at 20 Albany Street in Edinburgh, where mother and daughter Denise and Heather Walker hope their B&B will win over their fellow competitors. First impressions seem a success, with each of the guests happy with the high standards of the rooms, however one couple do not hesitate to comment on their poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit the Highland Guesthouse in Callander, run by Tom and Angela Jones. The guests are impressed by the hotel's cleanliness on arrival, but not everyone enjoys a traditional Scottish dancing activity - or the morning bagpipes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is the Fairfax Hotel in Skegness, where owner Kath Milward makes an early departure after a subdued dinner fails to wow her guests. Things do not look up for the hostess when Denise and Heather Walker discover something in their toilet, and Tom and Angela Jones decide to go on the hunt for a new room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sally Brealey welcome the contestants to the Wolds Village guest house in Bainton, East Yorkshire, where they will stay in themed rooms, but Kath Milward is not impressed with the gothic decor. The hosts organise an afternoon of mosaic-making, pitting Denise Walker against her artistic daughter Heather, and their breakfast gets the guests' approval. However, at feedback time some criticism comes as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Denise and Heather Walker from Albany Street tackle what they feel are unfair comments over the comfort of one of their beds, while Tom and Angela Jones of the Highland Guest House apologise for the lingering paint smells during Chris and Sally Brealey's time at their hotel. Kath Milward from the Fairfax Hotel discusses her low hosting scores from the other owners and accuses them of not being sympathetic, and Chris and Sally Brealey of Wolds Village challenge a complaint about bed size.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Ted and Diane Brewer first met on holiday over 20 years ago, they've dreamed about having a place of their own in the sun. With retirement approaching and Ted's kids grown up, they now feel the time is right to take the plunge. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £110,000 budget around the Mojacar area on Spain's Costa de Almeria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: With retirement on the horizon, Eve and Vinden Grace are looking for a place that they can use for holidays for now, but where they will eventually live half the year. The Gulf Coast of Florida has the perfect blend of lifestyle, culture and climate. Laura Hamilton shows them five homes for their £100,000 budget in and around Clearwater.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a father and son building an ambitious clifftop retreat and a young architect embarking on his first commission - a garden pavilion for his gran. Master craftsman Will Hardie sets out to transform the humble beach hut into the most unlikely of holiday getaways, and in Germany, George visits a modern house in a medieval town.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Sweden v Russia.
programme.desc: Sweden v Russia (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the Group B encounter, held at De Adelaarshorst in Deventer, the Netherlands.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Germany v Italy.
programme.desc: Germany v Italy (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Group B encounter at Willem II Stadion in Tilburg, the Netherlands. Defending champions Germany take on an Italian side who have never failed to make the last eight of this competition.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: Part one of two. Rose's friend brings her troubled 12-year-old sister along to a party, but the girl soon vanishes and Rose has to wake Dicte up in the middle of the night to help find her. When they are unable to locate the child, Dicte is forced to ask a reluctant Wagner for help. As Wagner investigates, all leads suggest the youngster was kidnapped and he suspects a couple of burglars of involvement. Dicte, on the other hand, pursues clues that point towards a paedophile perpetrator who has been liasing with children online. Crime drama, starring Iben Hjejle and Lars Brygmann. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Schizophrenic Graham, 75, is brought to King's College Hospital after being stabbed in the neck by a stranger on his doorstep, and needs a CT scan to reveal the extent of his wound. Former nursery nurse Pat, 89, also arrives on the ward, having been found at the bottom of the stairs at home with no recollection of how she got there, while palliative care nurse Tracey treats 72-year-old retired postman Michael, who was recently diagnosed with lung cancer.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: On a busy Saturday night at King's College Hospital, staff have to juggle the needs of elderly patients and sick children alongside those who are drunk or violent. Paramedics bring 12-year-old Grace into resus after she falls down a flight of stairs, while Sarah and Andy are concerned for their 10-month-old son Dexter, who has a high temperature and is unresponsive. Elsewhere, clinical site manager Gordon has a series of tests as a result of senior sister Jen noticing his bloodshot eye.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to three restaurants - Mojito, The Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini - to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a unique Japanese-Welsh fusion home in the Wye Valley, completely transformed from a damp old forester's house in 2013. Tamayo Hussey has missed Japan ever since she moved to the UK 15 years ago with her husband Nigel. To stave off the homesickness they decided to turn the property into a one-of-a-kind home, complete with roof bath, tatami room and sliding paper walls. Kevin finds out how this somewhat improvised building weathered one of the wettest winters on record and if it has brought the calm and tranquillity Tamayo remembers from her childhood in the Far East.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by The One Show's Alex Jones, The Last Leg's Alex Brooker and stand-up stars Sarah Millican and James Acaster to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton heads to California to investigate alternative dairy products at one of California's leading producers of almond milk, before meeting a scientist who has been raising genetically engineered goats whose milk he hopes might one day save half a million lives every year. Jimmy Doherty teams up with a fish detective on a covert mission buying and testing fish in Edinburgh to make sure it is the real deal, while Matt Tebbutt finds out what goes into spreadable butter.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Alex and Jacqui MacPherson, from Eastbourne, East Sussex, plan to head to warmer climes to enjoy their retirement. They're looking for a home in the Tampa area of Florida where they can spend the winter months, so Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Having inherited some money, Hampshire couple Phil and Bernie Smith are now in a position of being able to afford a holiday home. They have decided that south Tenerife's warm winter climate is ideal for whenever Phil's work as a gardener in the UK slows down, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five apartments within their £100,000 budget for them to choose between.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retirement is fast approaching for Chris Wood and Eleanor Clements, who are looking for a holiday home on the coast of north Tenerife where they can spend the winter months. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, including some stunning cliff-top apartments, within their £120,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Terry Windle and Julia Lenart got together 15 years ago, they have dreamed of having their own place in sunnier climes - and have decided Gran Canaria is the perfect place for them. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: John and William Dawson must gather in 2,000 sheep across a 3,500-acre expanse of the Dales, while in the Lakes, Trudy Harrison tries to turn round the village of Bootle's fortunes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the £1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedienne Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Worcestershire, where friends Geri Atterbury and Lorraine Rigby invite guests to stay at Greenways of Malvern. On arrival, couple Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are not impressed by the wild wallpaper, and the lack of an en-suite dismays mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Royal Forester at Bewdley in Worcestershire for their second stay, with proprietors Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker hoping to impress their guests with a trip to a local safari park. Sarah and Luke are impressed with their colourful room, but Sanjeev and Elinor have a `hairy' experience.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From Ferry Lodge in Holyhead, Anglesey, where mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway hope to impress the other contestants. However, things do not get off to a good start when Geri and Lorraine are overwhelmed by the number of laminated signs, Sean and Maxine begrudge paying 50p for toiletries and Sanjeev and Elinor are left unimpressed by the cleanliness of the establishment.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Partners Sanjeev Bhagotra and Elinor Roberts welcome their guests to Court Colman Manor, Bridgend, Glamorgan. Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are pleased with the size of their room on arrival, but Sarah Allaway discovers a collection of cobwebs in hers. During the afternoon, the groups take a lesson in fire-making, and the next morning a traditional Welsh breakfast is not to everyone's taste - with the hosts wondering whether tactical voting has played a part come feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one last time to find out what they have been paid. Geri kicks off proceedings by demanding to know why Sarah and Luke did not want a return visit to Greenways of Malvern, before they in turn confront Sanjeev and Elinor over their low cleanliness score for Ferry Lodge. Then the Court Colman Manor proprietors accuse Sarah and Luke of unfairly judging their hotel, before the payments are revealed and the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary examining an espionage operation conducted to gather information on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. Shown to mark the 80th anniversary of the king's abdication, the programmes examines recently declassified documents revealing the extent of the surveillance and who ordered it, as well as featuring dramatic reconstructions and eyewitness accounts.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the great dynasty, which began in 1917 when King George V changed the royal family's name from the German Saxe-Coburg and Gotha due to the anti-German sentiment in the British Empire during the First World War. The series uses the help of family insiders, fresh research and unique access to the royal archives at Windsor Castle to reveal the human frailties and secrets behind Britain's most powerful family.(n)

programme.title: Wallis Simpson: The Secret Letters
programme.desc: Biographer Anne Sebba examines 15 letters by Wallis Simpson, the American socialite who was widely perceived to have lured Edward VIII away from the British throne. The documents were written around the time of the king's abdication in December 1936 and indicate she was in love with another man - information that could change Simpson's historical profile.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. programme.title: 42 Ways to Kill Hitler
programme.desc: Over sixty years after the end of World War II, recently declassified documents and contemporary experiments offer insight into a multitude of attempts at assassinating one of the most feared and despised dictators of the 20th Century. As the Nazi war machine spread terror and death across Europe, there were at least forty-two documented plots to kill Adolf Hitler and bring his regime crumbling to the ground. But who were the men that offered to lay their own lives on the line for the sake of killing one of history's most despised tyrants, and just how did they plan on accomplishing such a formidable feat? In this documentary, the filmmakers at National Geographic offer detailed insight into the forty-two assassination plots that may have altered the course of history had they actually succeeded(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest Attacks
programme.desc: Sea Lion Attack. Australias beautiful land and oceans is inhabited by some of the most venomous and deadly creatures. On tonights episode Ella was enjoying a day out with friends skiing in the ocean when she was hit from below by an aggressive 600-pound Sea Lion that knocked out her teeth and severed her neck a millimeter from her carotid artery(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest
programme.desc: Outback Nightmare. Australia is filled with picturesque beaches, parks and rivers but they are not just appealing to the tourists. A late night fishing trip turned into disaster when two mates found themselves stranded on an isolated river when the boat's engine went dead. Rabeh left his friend Sal and decided to venture through the bush to get help. Stumbling in the dark, he fell onto a Redback spiders nest(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest Attacks
programme.desc: Minutes To Kill. Australia is a country of vast landscapes and raw beauty, and home to some of the most venomous and deadly predators in the world. Those who survive have extraordinary stories to tell? Rachael was swimming in a river with her brother in north Queensland when she felt something sting her across both legs(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest
programme.desc: Surfer v. Jaws. Australia is a country of vast landscapes and raw beauty, and home to some of the most venomous and deadly predators in the world. Zac was excited for a morning surfing with his older brother and mate at a remote surf break in Western Australia. It was a gray, overcast day, but the last thing on the young surfers mind was sharks until one took off his leg in a single bite. In far north Queensland, active Tom went on a pig hunting trip with his two dogs when the roles were reversed and they became the hunted... by a deadly saltwater crocodile. Finally, Duncans idyllic lifestyle living on a boat all changed when he was bitten by what he thought was a harmless mosquito. A simple mosquito bite grew into a large ulcer on his arm, and then spread to multiple sites on his body. It took months before doctors diagnosed the relentless flesh-eating bacteria as the Mycobacterium ulcerans, but by then he was at risk of losing his arm(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest
programme.desc: Beast in Her Backyard. Australia is a country of vast landscapes and raw beauty, and home to some of the most venomous and deadly predators in the world. Those who survive have extraordinary stories to tell. Glenn made it home from work in time for a sunset surf at Sydneys famous Bondi Beach. Just as he paddled out to catch a wave, he was attacked by a Great White shark. As everything around him went dark, Glenn didnt think he would survive. Then, eighteen-year-old Drewe was having fun with friends at a local swimming hole in tropical Queensland when he decided to go for a night swim. Suddenly his friends noticed a Saltwater Crocodile racing towards him. They screamed for him to get out of the river but, by the time he raised his head out the water to hear what they are saying, it was too late. The kangaroo is a cute Australian icon but what many people forget is that these seemingly cuddly animals are wild and unpredictable. Kirrily was stalked by a kangaroo in the back garden of her home. After days of it showing aggressive behavior, it bounded straight towards her at high speed. Instinctively she crouched down into a ball to protect herself(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest
programme.desc: Deadly Dingo. Live footage captured by his sister shows the agony endured by a box jellyfish victim in Queensland. A German backpacker is pursued by dingoes(n)

programme.title: Australia's Deadliest

programme.title: Sea of Hope: America's Underwater Treasures

programme.title: Deep Blue
programme.desc: Alastair Fothergill's nature documentary Deep Blue consists of 90 minutes of footage of undersea creatures -- living, surviving, fighting, and dying. Similar to like-minded documentaries such as Winged Migration and MicroCosmos, Deep Blue features footage from locations throughout the world. The great British actor Michael Gambon provides the narration, which favors involving the viewer emotionally over providing enlightening factual information on the creatures. The 22 segments of the film conclude with footage of how man has affected life under the sea. This film was originally produced for the British television series The Blue Planet. According to the filmmakers, some of the creatures seen here have never been previously recorded on film(n)

Unfortunately, her youthful charge Brian (Malachi Pearson) is an incorrigible brat--and even worse, the kid manages to get his head stuck in a staircase. Will DJ be able to extricate Brian before his highly judgemental parents return home? And back at "Chez Tanner", Danny (Bob Saget) hosts a poker game in his kitchen, resulting in yet another row between Jesse (John Stamos) and Becky (Lisa Loughlin)(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. Unfortunately, the transvestite also ends up involved in some dangerous escapades with the IRA. Comedy drama set in the 1970s, starring Cillian Murphy, Liam Neeson and Ruth Negga.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Having identified the body in the cellar as Jimmy Sullivan, Cassie visits the victim's mother, who is relieved that she might finally find out what happened to her son 39 years after he went missing. The detectives focus their investigation on the names in Jimmy's diary, who are revealed to be a government advisor, a priest, a retired bookkeeper and a housewife with a secret past. What part, if any, could these four wildly different people have played in Jimmy's disappearance and demise? Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star in the crime drama, with Tom Courtenay, Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill and Ruth Sheen.(n)

Here, John tells host Dr Phil McGraw he believes he was wrongly convicted and that the case was based on a series of lies and coincidence.(n)

Dr Trinh fears that an overweight woman who is failing to take her blood pressure tablets may be putting herself at risk of a stroke. Elsewhere in the practice, a baby is brought in with conjunctivitis, there is a case of deep vein thrombosis and a patient who has eaten nothing but crocodile meat has severe constipation.(n)

With such a high-profile murder, DI Goodman and the team are under pressure to solve the crime as soon as they possibly can, while Commissioner Patterson squares up to old enemy Anton Burrage, the governor-elect of the rival volleyball team's island. Joe Absolom (Doc Martin) and Colin McFarlane (The Dark Knight) guest star.(n)

programme.sub-title: Francis Brennan's Grand Vietnamese Tour: Hanoi & Mai Chau.
programme.desc: The tour party receives some lessons in traditional Vietnamese cooking, and visits the Temple of Literature and the Thay Pagoda in Hanoi. Francis then takes them out into the Mai Chau countryside and splits the group into two, sending half the tourists to a luxury eco-lodge and the rest to a basic village homestay - then reuniting them for a meal at a traditional snake restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson visits Angus Tynan, who has created a wildflower meadow and dragonfly pond in his garden. Using an identification guide, the pair observe different species including the scarce and beautiful emperor - which has only recently colonised Ireland. Plus, Angus's daughter shows the presenter a selection of bees that use the garden for collecting pollen.(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men

Comedy, starring Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, Ann-Margret, Burgess Meredith and Daryl Hannah. Includes RTÉ News and Weather.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Elsa - The Lioness That Changed the World.
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into how Joy Adamson's book Born Free, and the subsequent film adaptation, sparked new interest in nature and conservation in the 1960s. The world was introduced to orphaned lioness Elsa, which Joy and her husband George raised at their Kenyan reserve before releasing into the wild. The programme also details the darker side of the Adamsons' work in Africa, which eventually led to their untimely deaths. Includes contributions from David Attenborough and Born Free star Virginia McKenna.(n)

programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Hereford.

Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christopher's needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Maritime Inn landlady Pat gets her first full house of the season as Brixham's tourist trade picks up for the summer - but refuses to hire anyone to help her with the extra work. programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Ben Fogle presents the documentary exploring the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out how destructive high-speed winds can be through a series of spectacular reconstructions.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Donna is sent on a fact-finding mission to Gaza, where she is injured in a terrorist attack that leaves three others dead. As she remembers her earlier encounters with the British photojournalist who first opened her eyes to the reality of the conflict, the president faces the political dilemma of deciding how the US should respond. Jason Isaacs guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet weighs up his options as Israeli and Palestinian forces face off against each other. Kate and Leo clash over some advice she has given and Donna's life is threatened when she develops a pulmonary embolism. Meanwhile, Josh assumes a diplomatic role after he is approached to settle a dispute. Drama, starring Martin Sheen, Janel Moloney and Mary McCormack.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The squad examines the case of an investigative journalist who disappeared while working on a story about water pollution. They discover he was last seen with his ex-girlfriend, who belongs to a radical environmentalist group, but it also emerges his news stories have made him plenty of enemies. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: With Grissom away on sabbatical, the team is joined by new colleague Michael Keppler (Liev Schreiber), who soon gets to work investigating the murders of four unidentified women. It rapidly becomes clear that the victims were all killed by the same person, and the CSIs' initial suspicions lead them to a dental clinic. Guest starring Ned Beatty.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin recruits Danny to provide security for a notorious photographer, who is the key witness in her latest case against a doctor accused of illegally distributing prescription drugs. Jamie and Vinny follow up on a tip and bust a drugs operation, but their informant is later revealed to be a competing dealer selling medical marijuana to pay for her son's care facility. At home, tension mounts when Frank raises concerns over Henry's questionable driving and memory problems.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Colin questions Josh about his relationship with Donna as she recovers from her operation. Guest starring Jason Isaacs and Armin Mueller-Stahl.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The president orders a strike on the terrorist training camp as he continues to negotiate the peace settlement between the Israelis and Palestinians - but realises he and Leo will never agree on the issue. Meanwhile, Josh arrives back from his trip to Germany and expresses concern for the chief of staff's health - which turns out to be well founded. Starring Martin Sheen, with John Spencer and Bradley Whitford.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for a missing criminal defence attorney whose disappearance may be the result of a gradual slide into paranoid schizophrenia. Jerry O'Connell guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Catherine reluctantly agrees to deceive the rest of the team in a bid to help Keppler lure a murderer into a trap - but Nick is quick to realise that she is hiding something and alerts the others, who launch their own investigation into the case. Forensic drama, starring Marg Helgenberger and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: It's Halloween in New York and when a knife-wielding attacker dressed as Baron Samedi - the Haitian Spirit of Death - stabs a man dressed as a priest, Danny's investigation leads him into the world of voodoo. Elsewhere, Frank helps Garrett Moore when he is targeted by extortionists, Jamie becomes involved in the welfare of a volatile psychiatric patient, and Erin and Nicky take Jack and Sean trick-or-treating.(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Premiere. A feature-length account of the stockbroker and financier Bernie Madoff's Ponzi scheme, one of the biggest cases of financial fraud in US history, that led to financial ruin for countless people and institutions. Drama, starring Robert De Niro and Michelle Pfeiffer.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: New series. Jon organises the defence of the North, Cersei tries to even the odds, and Daenerys comes home. Return of the fantasy drama, starring Kit Harington, Emilia Clarke and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: Town sheriff Seth Bullock awaits the results of election day with frayed nerves. Meanwhile, the villainous prospector George Hearst remains in Deadwood, looking to attend to some unfinished business.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Mickey works with FBI agent Van Miller to gather incriminating evidence against movie star Sean Walker as a way of getting to his son. Meanwhile, Ray tries to get Tommy out of a sticky situation that threatens his career and Lena digs up a series of secrets on Frank. Drama, starring Liev Schreiber, Jon Voight, Frank Whaley and Jonathan Schaech.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: The emotionally fragile Bunchy is sent into a tailspin when he encounters someone from his past, while Ray's plan with Sully is put into action. The Donovans put on a united front as they go out in force to attend an event at the boxing club. Drama, starring Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Kevin and Mia set about planning their wedding but Jackie and Frank remain estranged. Meanwhile, the death of the All Saints news stand owner leaves the hospital staff reflecting on the anonymity of his life, and Zoey and Thor decide to plan a memorial. Dark comedy, starring Edie Falco and Merritt Wever.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Donna is sent on a fact-finding mission to Gaza, where she is injured in a terrorist attack that leaves three others dead. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: Regarding Susan Sontag
programme.desc: Documentary about of the life of critic, novelist, teacher, film-maker and political activist Susan Sontag, one of the most influential and provocative thinkers of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic struggles to help a woman who has not slept in 10 days, learning she rejected a dog bought by her girlfriend because she was planning to end the relationship. Things come to a head when the patient's liver fails, and the only way to keep her alive is to persuade her partner to donate a part of her own organ - while hiding the fact she is about to be dumped. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A 15-year-old faith healer is brought in with severe stomach cramps, and immediately causes problems for House and a furious Wilson by claiming to have miraculously cured a woman suffering from terminal cancer. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Robert Sean Leonard.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Part one of two. A police officer who started laughing after being shot is brought in, and soon starts to exhibit a string of bizarre ailments. As the patient gets worse, however, the doctors fear for their colleague's condition. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: An esteemed neurosurgeon vanishes after a late-night jog with her ex-husband. The team discovers the missing woman was preparing to testify against a fellow doctor in a negligence case. Drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the squad investigate the disappearance of a father-to-be who went missing after a high-school reunion - and find a splash of his blood in the place he was last seen. programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the case of a debutante who died at a ball in 1968, after a newspaper report reveals that the man who escorted her to the event has been charged with murdering his wife - whose death bears an uncanny resemblance to that of the young girl's. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the case of a bank clerk murdered during an armed robbery in 2000, after a string of identical heists involving thieves in Johnny Cash masks provides new evidence. The team retraces every step of the old case to find the killer.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Valens must face his demons when a high-profile drug case he worked on is reopened eight years later. Rush and the team are shocked to discover he operated undercover, and the investigation ended with the death of a drug courier with whom he had become involved.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush makes a discovery that leads her to reopen the case of a female tennis champion murdered in 1973. programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate when several federal government employees succumb to symptoms of a heart attack. Reid anxiously awaits his trial date.(n)

Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: Bruce Almighty
programme.desc: God tires of a down-on-his-luck reporter's constant complaining, so passes on His powers to give him a taste of ultimate responsibility. The newsman falls in love with his extraordinary abilities - but a never-ending stream of incoming prayers and his ambitious attempt to please everyone soon prove there is more to the job than meets the eye. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Jennifer Aniston and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis.(n)

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie
programme.desc: Johnny Knoxville and his gang of daredevil friends bring the MTV series to the big screen. As usual, they perform a variety of weird and wonderful stunts, including crawling across dozens of mousetraps while wearing rodent make-up, and being rolled down bowling lanes on skateboards. Comedy, with Bam Margera, Henry Rollins, Spike Jonze and Tony Hawk.(n)

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: An American counter-terrorism unit travels around the world on the lookout for threats to global peace, causing much destruction to major world cities in the process. The biggest current menace is North Korean leader Kim Jong-il and an organisation much closer to home - the Film Actors Guild. Satirical puppet comedy, voiced by South Park creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: A Playboy bunny is ejected from Hugh Hefner's mansion for being considered over-the-hill on her 27th birthday, and has to find a new home and a fresh role in life. She becomes the unlikely house mother for a dowdy college sorority, and sets about giving its inmates a pin-up style makeover and turning their social lives around. Comedy, starring Anna Faris, Colin Hanks, Emma Stone and Kat Dennings.(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots
programme.desc: A pilot joins an elite squad to take part in a dangerous mission, but faces a struggle to live down his father's bad reputation - and win the love of a glamorous psychiatrist. Comedy spoofing action movies - principally Top Gun - starring Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Cary Elwes, Kevin Dunn and William O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: Two college graduates faced with the prospect of deciding what to do with their lives find themselves faced with a more immediate crisis - getting and keeping a job. Their search for employment takes them through a succession of strange experiences and even stranger workplaces. Comedy, starring Miles Teller, Anna Kendrick, Bryan Cranston and Alison Brie.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Family man Rusty Griswold spent his childhood family holidays stumbling from one disaster to another with his hapless father. He is determined that his own road trip with his wife and kids will go better - but soon finds the apple has not fallen far from the tree. Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2: Extended Edition
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Great Fairy Rescue
programme.desc: Tinker Bell travels to the human world for the first time and befriends a little girl. However, when the child's scientist father discovers the fairy, he takes her away for study in the hope of learning more about the magical creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Mae Whitman and Michael Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An Antarctic scientific expedition has to be aborted when a blizzard hits, forcing their guide to leave behind his team of huskies in the frozen wilderness. He is determined to return and rescue the animals, but in the meantime, the dogs have to rely on pack instinct alone to ensure their survival in the hostile climate. Disney adventure, starring Paul Walker, Bruce Greenwood and Jason Biggs.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pete's Dragon
programme.desc: A young boy orphaned by a car crash and left alone in a forest befriends a giant, fire-breathing dragon. Fantasy adventure, starring Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford and Oakes Fegley.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound
programme.desc: An orphaned fox cub is taken in by a kindly widow, and becomes firm friends with a puppy belonging to a hunter. However, as they grow to adulthood, the dog is trained to prey on foxes, and the two animals realise their friendship may not survive as they are expected to be natural enemies. Animated adventure, with the voices of Mickey Rooney and Kurt Russell.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pete's Dragon
programme.desc: A young boy orphaned by a car crash and left alone in a forest befriends a giant, fire-breathing dragon. Fantasy adventure, starring Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford and Oakes Fegley.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: Jungle 2 Jungle
programme.desc: A businessman ventures deep into the Amazon to look for his estranged doctor wife seeking a divorce, only to discover he has a 13-year-old son who has been raised as part of a jungle tribe. The boy is sent back to New York with his father, but has a lot to learn about the modern world. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Short, JoBeth Williams and Sam Huntington.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecked
programme.desc: A youngster joins a sailing ship to raise money to save his parents' farm, but soon finds himself mixed up in adventure after being thrown overboard and washed up on an island inhabited by a gang of pirates. Disney adventure, starring Gabriel Byrne, Stian Smestad and Louisa Haigh.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: A Goofy Movie
programme.desc: The Disney cartoon dog takes his son on an old-fashioned fishing trip in an attempt to bond with the lad. However, young Max has boasted to his pals that he is going to a pop concert in Los Angeles, and has a few ideas on how to trick his dopey dad. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Bill Farmer, Jason Marsden and Wallace Shawn.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Surviving gunslinger Chris is hired by Mexican revolutionaries to rescue their leader from a military prison. After assembling a crack team including a knife-fighting expert and a firearms aficionado, the group embarks on its mission - but underestimates the depths to which its enemies will sink. Second sequel to the Western, starring George Kennedy, James Whitmore, Monte Markham, Joe Don Baker and Reni Santoni.(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of genetically engineered clones bred to be the perfect assassin takes on a mission that strikes close to home. A corporation intends to use the technology that created him to build an army of superhuman killers. As the assassin fights to bring them down, he uncovers the dark secrets surrounding his origin. Action thriller, starring Rupert Friend, Hannah Ware and Zachary Quinto.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Wily rogue Captain Jack Sparrow finds an old debt coming back to haunt him. Years before, he sold his soul to the legendary Davy Jones, who has now risen from the depths of the ocean to collect what he is owed - with a giant sea monster at his command. Meanwhile, ruthless trader Lord Beckett is intent on seizing control of the Caribbean, and sets out to turn Jack and his allies against one another. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley, Jack Davenport and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer, and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: The super-powered team takes on a mysterious alien who has been sent by his planet-eating master to prepare Earth for obliteration. While the four heroes try to find a way to foil its plans, an old enemy returns, intent on seizing the extraterrestrial's power. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Michael Chiklis, Chris Evans and Jessica Alba, with the voice of Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 4.0
programme.desc: Tough New York cop John McClane is sent to escort a computer hacker to Washington for questioning. During this routine operation he stumbles on a criminal mastermind's plan to launch a technological terrorist attack on the US, and is forced to enlist the hacker's aid in foiling the evil scheme. Action thriller sequel, with Bruce Willis, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long and Maggie Q.(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of genetically engineered clones bred to be the perfect assassin takes on a mission that strikes close to home. A corporation intends to use the technology that created him to build an army of superhuman killers. As the assassin fights to bring them down, he uncovers the dark secrets surrounding his origin. Action thriller sequel, with Bruce Willis, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long and Maggie Q.(n)

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: I Am Wrath
programme.desc: A grieving widower is shocked when his wife's killers manage to evade justice, so he seeks the aid of an old friend in taking the law into his own hands. However, as he hunts down the murderers, he discovers they have friends in very high places. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: The super-powered team takes on a mysterious alien who has been sent by his planet-eating master to prepare Earth for obliteration. While the four heroes try to find a way to foil its plans, an old enemy returns, intent on seizing the extraterrestrial's power. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Michael Chiklis, Chris Evans and Jessica Alba, with the voice of Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Spy - Extended Version
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even dealier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman.(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Fearless hunter Allan Quatermain teams up with a host of other characters from Victorian literature - including Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Tom Sawyer and Dr Jekyll - to put a stop to the nefarious Fantom's evil plot to bring about a world war. Fantasy adventure, based on Alan Moore's comic-book series, starring Sean Connery, Shane West, Stuart Townsend, Richard Roxburgh, Peta Wilson and Tony Curran.(n)

programme.title: The 5th Wave
programme.desc: Earth suffers a series of four devastating attacks from alien invaders, that leaves civilisation in ruins. As the human race awaits the fifth and final onslaught that will wipe them out, a teenage girl tries to protect her younger brother in a dangerous wilderness - and gets drawn into a plan to fight back against the aliens. Sci-fi adventure based on Rick Yancey's novel, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Spy - Extended Version
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe.
