programme.title: Leaving Las Vegas
programme.desc: Compelling drama about the love shared by a couple who have hit rock bottom. An alcoholic, fired from his Hollywood job, moves to Vegas with the intention of drinking himself to death. He meets a prostitute on the run from her pimp, they fall in love and he moves in. They make a pact that she will not ask him to stop drinking and he will not question her lifestyle. Nicolas Cage won an Oscar for Best Actor(n)

programme.title: Wolf Totem
programme.desc: In this exciting adventure set in 1960s China, a student from Beijing is sent to teach a nomadic tribe in Mongolia. While there, he cares for and adopts a wolf cub, and their bond causes him to see the world in a new light(n)

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: Maggie (Greta Gerwig), a young woman longing to start a family, becomes involved in a complicated love triangle with a struggling novelist named John (Ethan Hawke) and his haughty theorist wife Georgette (Julianne Moore). After a period of flirtation, John and Maggie fall in love and have a baby together, but their new life still leaves her unfulfilled. Maggie's Plan received its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: A moody memory piece about five doomed teenage sisters in 1970s suburbia(n)

programme.title: Rio, I Love You
programme.desc: Another installment of the "Cities of Love" series, this anthology film depicts romantic encounters in different neighborhoods of Rio de Janeiro. In all, 10 shorts are woven together to spin a tale of love in "the Marvelous City."(n)

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: Ben Kingsley crackles with intensity as a mad-dog Englishman in this comedy-drama. Kingsley plays Don Logan, a menacing London thug who travels to the Spanish villa of retired safecracker Gal Dove. Don has one more job for Gal---and it's a killer. Ray Winstone, Ian McShane, Amanda Redman(n)

programme.title: Horns
programme.desc: An adaptation of Joe Hill's novel about a young man who grows horns overnight, which aid in helping him discover the killer of his girlfriend(n)

programme.title: Buffalo '66
programme.desc: Newly paroled Billy Brown's first act of freedom is to kidnap a young woman, demanding that she pose as his wife to impress his indifferent parents. Strangely, the kidnap victim decides she likes Billy quite a bit and plays her part in a painful charade that reveals the story of his neglected childhood. Directed by and stars Vincent Gallo. Christina Ricci, Ben Gazzara, Anjelica Huston(n)

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: A moody memory piece about five doomed teenage sisters in 1970s suburbia(n)

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: James Franco directs this adaptation of William Faulkner's The Sound and the Fury, the writer's tale of the Compson family, a once wealthy Southern clan devolving into obscurity. Tim Blake Nelson portrays the patriarch, a boozy lawyer who oversees the lives of his children with cynical monologues delivered through an alcoholic haze. Quentin, the oldest child, goes to Harvard, but he's very close with Caddy, the only daughter in the family who has a child out of wedlock. Second son Jason attempts to rule the family with an iron fist, but he's full of resentment towards Caddy's bastard child. All of them attempt to care for the developmentally disabled Benjy (Franco). Franco employs a fractured approach to the narrative in an attempt to capture Faulkner's distinctive prose style. The Sound and the Fury screened at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Rudderless
programme.desc: A grieving father performs his late son's songs in order to keep his spirit alive in this deeply affecting musical drama. Later, the father and a young musician form a band that transforms their lives in ways neither dreamed possible(n)

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: Ben Kingsley crackles with intensity as a mad-dog Englishman in this comedy-drama. Kingsley plays Don Logan, a menacing London thug who travels to the Spanish villa of retired safecracker Gal Dove. Don has one more job for Gal---and it's a killer. Ray Winstone, Ian McShane, Amanda Redman(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: In 1992, Reservoir Dogs transformed Quentin Tarantino practically overnight from an obscure, unproduced screenwriter and part-time actor to the most influential new filmmaker of the 1990s. The story looks at what happens before and after (but not during) a botched jewelry store robbery organized by Joe Cabot (Lawrence Tierney). Mr. White (Harvey Keitel) is a career criminal who takes a liking to newcomer Mr. Orange (Tim Roth) and enjoys showing him the ropes. Mr. Pink (Steve Buscemi) is a weaselly loner obsessed with professionalism. Mr. Blonde (Michael Madsen) has just gotten out of jail after taking the rap on a job for Cabot; he's grateful for the work but isn't the same person he used to be. While Mr. Blonde goes nuts during the heist, the thieves are surprised by the sudden arrival of the police, and Mr. Pink is convinced one of their team is a cop. So who's the rat? What do they do about Mr. Blonde? And what do they do with Mr. Orange, who took a bullet in the gut and is slowly bleeding to death? Reservoir Dogs jumps back and forth between pre- and post-robbery events, occasionally putting the narrative on pause to let the characters discuss such topics as the relative importance of tipping, who starred in Get Christie Love!, and what to do when you enter a men's room full of cops carrying a briefcase full of marijuana(n)

programme.title: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
programme.desc: Ghost Dog lives in a shack on the roof of a disused building. He lives his life according to the Hagakure: The Way Of The Samurai. He is employed by a small-time gangster family and when they betray him, he sets out for revenge..(n)

programme.title: Horns
programme.desc: An adaptation of Joe Hill's novel about a young man who grows horns overnight, which aid in helping him discover the killer of his girlfriend(n)

programme.title: Risen
programme.desc: A Roman soldier in biblical times has a crisis of faith when he witnesses firsthand the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ(n)

programme.title: The Boxer
programme.desc: After 14 years in prison, a former member of the IRA returns to his neighborhood in Belfast to rebuild his life and restore his dignity in the boxing ring - despite the personal, cultural and political turmoil that surrounds him. Daniel Day-Lewis, Emily Watson, Brian Cox, Ken Stott, Gerard McSorley, Eleanor Methven, Ciaran Fitzgerald, David McBlain, Damien Denny, Clayon Stewart, Kenneth Cranham(n)

programme.title: Love Is All You Need
programme.desc: A widowed Englishman and a Danish hairdresser who's been left by her husband forge a fragile romance during a trip to Italy to see their son and daughter get married(n)

programme.title: The Children of Huang Shi
programme.desc: About young British journalist, George Hogg, who with the assistance of a courageous Australian nurse, saves a group of orphaned children during the Japanese occupation of China(n)

programme.title: Elle
programme.desc: In this thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, the head of a successful video-game company (Isabelle Huppert) has her world turned upside down when she is sexually assaulted in her home. Instead of reporting the crime to the police, however, she opts to hunt down the man responsible on her own. When she finally tracks down her assailant, they become locked in a dangerous game that threatens to consume them both(n)

programme.title: Risen
programme.desc: A Roman soldier in biblical times has a crisis of faith when he witnesses firsthand the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's multi Oscar-nominated epic stars Daniel Day-Lewis as William Cutting, the leader of a violent gang in 19th-century New York who take on their rivals, led by Liam Neeson. Neeson dies and his young son disappears, only to return a man (Leonardo DiCaprio) torn between a thirst for revenge and a fascination for the charismatic Cutting(n)

programme.title: Revolutionary Road
programme.desc: In fifties Connecticut, Frank and April Wheeler struggle to hold on to their dreams when boredom and resentment engulf their seemingly perfect marriage. Drama(n)

programme.title: Elle
programme.desc: In this thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, the head of a successful video-game company (Isabelle Huppert) has her world turned upside down when she is sexually assaulted in her home. Instead of reporting the crime to the police, however, she opts to hunt down the man responsible on her own. When she finally tracks down her assailant, they become locked in a dangerous game that threatens to consume them both(n)

programme.title: Kill Your Darlings
programme.desc: Daniel Radcliffe stars as Beat Generation icon Allen Ginsberg in this biopic set during the famed poet's early years at Columbia University, and centering on a murder investigation involving Ginsberg, his handsome classmate Lucien Carr, and fellow Beat author William S. Burroughs. The year is 1944. Ginsberg (Radcliffe) is a young student at Columbia University when he falls hopelessly under the spell of charismatic classmate Carr (Dane DeHaan). Alongside Carr, Ginsberg manages to strike up friendships with aspiring writers William S. Burroughs (Ben Foster) and Jack Kerouac (Jack Huston) that would cast conformity to the wind, and serve as the foundation of the Beat movement. Meanwhile, an older outsider named David Kammerer falls deeply and madly in love with the impossibly cool Carr. Later, when Kammerer dies under mysterious circumstances, police arrest Kerouac, Burroughs, and Carr as potential suspects, paving the way for an investigation that would have a major impact on the lives of the three emerging artists. Jennifer Jason Leigh, Kyra Sedgwick, David Cross, and Michael C. Hall co-star(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Glitzy, flash and entertaining tale of three drag queens - Terence Stamp, Hugo Weaving and Guy Pearce - who embark on the run-down bus they've named 'Priscilla' to cross Australia and perform in Alice Springs. Written and directed by Stephan Elliott(n)

programme.title: Bye Bye, Love
programme.desc: Three single fathers - ladies man Dave, cynic Vic and lovelorn Donny - get a crash course in parenting over a weekend in which the trio have access to their kids. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: She's the One
programme.desc: The love lives of two brothers interconnect as Francis cheats on his wife with Mickey's ex-girlfriend, while Mickey impulsively marries a stranger(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Tennis player Peter Colt (Paul Bettany) is about to retire, unable to fulfill his dream of becoming one of the world's top players. He holds position 119 in the world ranking, but, all the same, he is invited to play in Wimbledon. The traditional tournament, where he finds himself for the first time, seems the ideal place for a farewell, to start a new life the following day as a tennis coach, though the plan might not be very appealing. At the same championship is Lizzie Bradbury (Kirsten Dunst), heading for stardom and dating the American, Jake Hammond (Austin Nichols), another great figure in the circuit. But Peter and Lizzie happen to meet one day and their destiny starts to look different from what seemed unchangeable(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: Ben Stiller's dark satire about the power of television charts a yuppie's descent into a personal hell. After Matthew Broderick splits up with his girlfriend and moves into a new flat he invites Jim Carrey to install his cable TV. But things soon take a dark turn as Carrey decides to become Broderick's best friend before stalking him, taking over his family, his girlfriend and his life(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: A state trooper with multiple personality disorder tries to save a woman from thugs(n)

programme.title: Down to You
programme.desc: Whimsical romantic comedy about two college students, Al and Imogen, who fall in love. However, a youthful fear of commitment threatens to destabilise their romance, and when Imogen gets an opportunity to study elsewhere, Al breaks up the relationship - only to realise that he has made a huge mistake(n)

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his love for Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the baseball team he supports, the Boston Red Sox. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch and released in America under that title, the two leads bring the same warmth and humour to their roles as their British counterparts. Even sports fans unfamiliar with baseball will know the pain that comes from attending an important function when your team are playing a crucial match(n)

programme.title: Undertaking Betty
programme.desc: A woman whose husband is cheating on her and an undertaker who's in love with her for ages, decide to fake her death so they can be together. However, the other town's undertaker who loves over-the-top funerals complicates things(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: When the world's most valuable treasures are stolen, shaking up the governments of Britain, Italy and Japan, the authorities set up an international 'dream team' to solve the crimes. The legendary Pink Panther Diamond was the latest to disappear. So guess who¿s joining the team? Yes, the intrepid yet awkward French Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Steve Martin)! Even though Chief Inspector Dreyfus (John Cleese taking over acting duties from Kevin Kline) would much prefer seeing Clouseau issuing traffic tickets¿(n)

programme.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: Psychedelic road movie, adapted from Hunter S Thompson's cult novel, about a journalist and his attorney friend who drive from LA to Las Vegas on a huge drugs binge, finding paranoia and misadventure at every turn(n)

programme.title: Johnny Be Good
programme.desc: Comedy about a top American football star who receives many tempting but illegal offers of scholarships from leading colleges. Should he stay with his friends at State University or move up?(n)

programme.title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
programme.desc: A romantic comedy about a prim, middle-aged British governess who finds herself caught in a love triangle when she goes to work for a dizzy American actress in 1939 London(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Artifact hunter and archaeologist extraordinaire Ben Franklin Gates learns of his own family's implication in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth. Gates must then locate an elusive diary, not only to clear his family's name, but to unearth and connect several secrets, buried within the book, that point to a massive, global conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Men at Work
programme.desc: A pair of garbage workers (Charlie Sheen and Emilio Estevez) are shocked to find the body of a city councilman in one of their trash cans. With help from a supervisor (Keith David), the duo must solve the case and find the man's killer while hiding the body from the cops. Estevez also directed and provided the screenplay for Men at Work(n)

programme.title: Because I Said So

programme.title: Hoop Dreams
programme.desc: This documentary about the aspirations of high-school basketball players from inner city Chicago won awards from the Sundance film festival, the New York Film Critics Circle, and the Academy Award (Oscar) for best editing. Two young men are followed during their entire high-school career, beginning with their participation in playground games and ending with their being recruited by colleges. The obstacles these young men face include parental drug addiction, family poverty, and inner-city violence, as well as the usual obstacles that arise in competition, including physical injuries. While each aspires to leave the ghetto, there are many reasons to suppose they may not be able to, despite each beating the odds against them by winning college scholarships(n)

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: Television actress Jennifer Anniston makes her feature-film debut in a starring role as Kate, a bright but mousey and single young advertising executive seeking to climb the corporate ladder. But though she has all the right qualifications professionally, Kate has a problem in her boss's eyes: she's single. In his opinion, only married and henceforth deeply indebted people should be on the fast track for promotions because they have more motivation to remain loyal to a company. Desperate to ascend, Kate follows overenthusiastic colleague Darcy's (Illeana Douglas) bad advice and fabricates a fabulous fiance. Kate's other motivation for inventing a lover is to capture the attentions of the office Lothario, Sam (Kevin Bacon), a lean, sexy guy who thinks Kate is too good to warrant his bad-boy affections. For her dream fiance, Kate chooses handsome, heroic wedding-photographer Nick (Jay Mohr), whom she recently met at a friend's marriage in Boston. Not realizing that Nick is secretly in love with her, Kate offers him $1,000 to pretend to be her intended and to break up with her during an important business dinner. Meanwhile, Sam, upon learning that Kate is a taken women, launches a successful seduction campaign. With everything finally going her way, Kate couldn't be happier. But when Nick finally arrives, her careful plans begin to go spectacularly awry, and she is forced to face the truth about her feelings for the sneaky Sam and the patient, knightly Nick. Picture Perfect is an average-quality romantic comedy, one that would work especially on television. Anniston does well in her role as the confused Kate, exuding an off-beat beauty, considerable charm and a calculated comic timing, but whether or not she has the chops to make it as a movie star remains to be seen. Her co-star Mohr (Tom Cruise's slimy rival in Jerry Maguire) is more natural and charismatic. Though more low-key than the tightly-wound Anniston, he managed to steal most of the scenes in which he appeared(n)

programme.title: Ever After
programme.desc: Andy Tennant's romantic comedy fantasy is set in 16th-century France, where, following the death of her father, Danielle De Barbarac is assigned kitchen duties in the castle by her stepmother Baroness Rodmilla de Ghent. A chance meeting with Prince Henry, heir apparent to the throne, leads to the potential for a romance that she fears could be ruined if he discovers a masquerade. A 'fairy-godmother' in the shape of Leonardo da Vinci eventually smoothes the path of true love but thanks to Barrymore, this is not another soft retelling of Cinderella but a punchy, energetic film with Barrymore in excellent form as the forthright Danielle. Edited for language and mild violence(n)

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: This modernization of Edmond Rostand's Cyrano de Bergerac casts Steve Martin as C. D. Bates, the fearless, quick-witted fire chief of a Washington State resort town. Bates' most trusted fireman is the handsome but tongue-tied Chris McDonell (Rick Rossovich). Both men are in love with the beautiful Roxanne Kowalski (Darryl Hannah), but Bates, adorned with a huge nose that makes Bob Hope look like Nanette Fabray, is convinced that he's too homely to win Roxanne's heart. Thus, in the self-sacrificing tradition of Cyrano de Bergerac, Bates courts Roxanne vicariously by feeding his rival Chris the proper romantic words and phrases. The inherent pathos in Roxanne is offset by moments of slapstick, notably the scene wherein C. D. Bates vanquishes a pair of hooligans with a tennis racket. Steve Martin himself is credited with the screenplay for Roxanne, though he generously cites Edmond Rostand as his inspiration(n)

programme.desc: Bestowed with superpowers when a lab experiment goes unexpectedly awry, an average beagle becomes the savior of Capitol City as everyone's favorite canine do-gooder embarks on his first-ever live-action adventure. programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: What's in the Box. As a repairman (Sterling Holloway) works on his malfunctioning television set, middle-aged TV addict Joe Britt (William Demarest) fusses and fumes, while his wife Phyllis (Joan Blondell) launches another of her nag sessions. Once the repairman leaves, Joe tunes in to his favorite program, only to watch in amazement as his own extramarital dalliances are recreated on the 21-inch screen. Dumbfounded, Joe continues watching, whereupon the screen is filled with images of a dire and dismal future for the battling Britts. The second of Martin M. Goldsmith's Twilight Zone scripts (and the last episode directed by Twilight Zone veteran Richard L. Bare, "What's in the Box" was oriignally telecast March 13, 1964(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Masks. On the eve of Mardi Gras in New Orleans, dying millionaire Jason Foster (Robert Keith) summons his greedy relatives to his mansion. In a faint but firm voice, Foster informs his niece Emily (Virginia Gregg), nephew-in-law Wilfred (Milton Selzer), and Emily and Wilfred's despicable offspring Wilfred, Jr. (Alan Sues) and Paula (Brooke Hayward), that -- despite his hatred of them -- he intends to leave them his entire fortune. But there's a condition -- all four relatives must don grotesque masks which reflect their true natures -- and they are forbidden to remove those masks until the stroke of midnight. This memorable Twilight Zone episode was directed by Ida Lupino, who had starred in the first-season Twilight Zone entry "The Sixteen-Millimeter Shrine." Written by Rod Serling, "The Masks" originally aired on March 20, 1964(n)

programme.desc: Yard Sale. Having long suffered in silence as wife Peg (Katey Sagal) has purchased one useless item after another at various yard sales, Al (Ed O'Neill) finally says "ENOUGH!" when his wife drags home a bulky boar's head. Employing the "Bigger Idiot Theory", which insists that one man's trash is another man's treasure, Al tries to purge himself of Peg's collection of clutter by holding his own yard sale. Alas, no one seems to be in the market for a globe of the Southern hemisphere or a dead parrot, so Al comes up with still another scheme: "Bundyland"! This is the final episode of Married. . .With Children's fourth season(n)

Though the kids are easily bought off, Peg's decision is swayed by one glance at Al's replacement, muscle-bound Sven Hunkstrom (Dan Blom). But in the ninth inning, Sven is injured--so guess who steps up to the pitcher's mound? This episode manages to include virtually every baseball-movie cliché known to man (including a wickedly hilarious send-up of Lou Gehrig's farewell speech), and as a bonus features future Beverly Hills 90210 regular Ian Ziering in a small role(n)

programme.desc: A man is rushed to hospital with a sword stuck in his head after taking part in a battle reenactment, and two patients have the same symptoms after attending the same fashion show.(n)

programme.title: Sex Sent Me to the ER
programme.desc: A malfunctioning sex toy will not stop buzzing, but the owners go ahead with a dinner party anyway. A date ends in disaster.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Quit Claim. The team go undercover to investigate a hit and run, but a surprising twist brings the US Attorney's office into play(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Burn Card. The tables are dramatically turned when Detective Ed Green becomes the subject of an internal investigation. When the respected cop shoots dead a murder suspect, a probe carried out by Detective Kevin Bernard (Anthony Anderson) reveals that he had connections to his victim. Parts of Green's past are dredged up that he'd taken pains to conceal. Forced to put their personal feelings aside, the DA reluctantly pursue murder charges(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Second Opinion. Detectives Logan and Briscoe are confronted with an unethical doctor who practices nutritional counselling with so-called 'unobtrusive' methods. Detectives Logan and Briscoe are confronted with an unethical doctor who practices nutritional counselling with so-called 'unobtrusive' methods(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Coma. A comedy club owner comes under suspicion for having shot his wife, now comatose with a bullet in her head, after it's discovered he was abusive and she was about to divorce him(n)

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Three Ghosts. Oliver is drugged after a fight with Cyrus Gold and left for dead. Felicity tries to cure him but the cure causes Oliver to hallucinate and he is visited by ghosts from his past. Meanwhile, Barry and Felicity grow closer; and Roy is captured and tortured by Brother Blood(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Death Becomes Them. Zankou taps the services of the insidious Alchemist (John Kassir) to weaken the nerves of the sisters in a ploy to gain control of the Book of Shadows. Meanwhile, Darryl struggles to keep Insp. Sheridan (Jenya Lano) in the dark about the Charmed Ones(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Something Wicca This Way Goes...?. In the last episode of season seven, the Charmed Ones attempt to divert Zankou's attention away from the Nexus, but he hatches a plan to absorb all their powers and is able to anticipate their every move. The sisters are forced to make a terrifying choice between sacrificing their powers or their lives, just as the legal investigation into their affairs gathers new momentum(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Still Charmed & Kicking. After being presumed dead, the Halliwell sisters begin their demon-free existence with new identities: Phoebe is overwhelmed with visions of her future husband; Paige begins hearing her whitelighter call, which draws her to a mysterious young witch; Piper attempts to deal with her financial situation, the club and her children(n)

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Slash Fiction. Sam and Dean are cloned by two Leviathans who go on a killing spree as the two brothers, which lands the real Sam and Dean on the FBI's most wanted list. Meanwhile, Bobby tries to find a way to kill the Leviathans(n)

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Season 7, Time for a Wedding!. Something is definitely afoot when Sam randomly decides to settle down and tie the knot. A suspicious Dean, however, is far from convinced(n)

programme.sub-title: How to Win Friends and Influence Monsters

programme.title: Supernatural

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Adventures in Babysitting. Sam helps a teen girl search for her missing father, who is also a supernatural hunter. Meanwhile, Dean tries to take down Dick Roman(n)

programme.desc: The 200th in the 10th. The show's 200th episode is an homage to Alfred Hitchcock's films that takes place in 1950s Hollywood, where LAPD detective Brennan teams up with jewel thief Booth when the latter is framed for the murder of a wealthy socialite(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The Psychic in the Soup. Avalon Harmonia lends her expertise to an investigation when the body of a psychic is found rotting in the trunk of a tree(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The Teacher in the Books. A teacher is found dead in an abandoned bookstore, and her coworkers and students are suspects(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The Baker in the Bits. When the body of an ex-con is found in pieces, the Jeffersonian team investigates a local bakery known for employing former felons(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The Putter in the Rough. A miniature-golf star's death reveals the sport's highly competitive nature(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
programme.desc: Action-packed espionage thriller about a government assassin with amnesia and his mission to piece together his identity while evading his pursuers. He flees from Zurich with a young woman in tow but comes to realise that her involvement in his escape has placed her life in danger. Based on the best-selling novel by Robert Ludlum(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: Bourne is once again forced to take up his former life as a trained assassin when a CIA operation to purchase classified Russian documents goes wrong(n)

programme.desc: Blue Bamboo. When a singer (Laura Linney) who once worked for a nightclub owner is arrested for his murder, her lawyer uses "battered-woman syndrome" as a defense. Kaskel: Joyce Reehling. Hellman: Ron Orbach. Judge: Shawn Elliott. Kincaid: Jill Hennessy. McCoy: Sam Waterston(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Family Values. After a woman's murder, the detectives question both her first and second husbands---and her daughter(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: White Rabbit. A routine investigation uncovers evidence that leads Briscoe and Logan to a long-time fugitive, a radical Vietnam War opponent on the run since a 1971 burglary that left a policeman dead(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Competence. When Lt Van Buren is the victim of an attempted holdup by two teens, she fires her gun and kills one of them, and the detectives are faced with the fact that she shot an unarmed child in the back(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Precious. When Briscoe and Logan suspect that a missing infant may have been murdered by her parents rather than kidnapped, they uncover a terrible family secret which hides a mentally ill serial killer(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Virtue. McCoy uses a charge of "larceny by extortion" against a member of council accused of demanding sex for a law-firm partnership(n)

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: House Counsel. The killing of a man who had served as a juror in a mob trial leads to a battle of wills between McCoy and his long-time friend, the suspect's attorney(n)

programme.title: Journey 2: The Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Sean Anderson partners with his mom's husband on a mission to find his grandfather, who is thought to be missing on a mythical island(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings - The Two Towers
programme.desc: Part two of Peter Jackson's magnum opus. The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers begins in the hills of Emyn Muil, where lost Hobbits Frodo and Sam discover they are being followed by the mysterious Gollum. a mercurial creature who has been warped by the Ring, Gollum promises to guide the Hobbits to the Black Gates of Mordor if they will release him. Across Middle-earth Aragorn, the Elf archer Legolas and Gimli the Dwarf encounter the besieged Rohan kingdom, whose once great King Theoden has fallen under Saruman's deadly spell through the manipulations of his spy, the sinister Wormtongue. Gandalf has been reborn as Gandalf the White following his cataclysmic fight with the Balrog, and reminds Aragorn of his destiny to unite the Rohan people with the last remaining stronghold of Human resistance: Gondor. The Fellowship face unimaginable armies and deception as they stand against the powerful forces spreading from the Two Towers: Orthanc Tower in Isengard, where the corrupted wizard Saruman has bred a lethal army 10,000 strong; and Sauron's fortress at Barad-dûr, deep within the dark lands of Mordor(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: Peter Jackson's multi-Oscar-winning epic fantasy trilogy, based on JRR Tolkien's books, reaches its conclusion. Frodo the Ring-bearer and his faithful companion Sam are within sight of Mordor, guided by Gollum. Gollum was once a Hobbit but now, because he took possession of the Ring aeons ago, he is a twisted, duplicitous creature with plans to regain it. Meanwhile, the remainder of the Fellowship, led by Gandalf and Aragorn, must defend the last stronghold of man, Minas Tirith, against Sauron's might. And then, to buy Frodo and Sam time, they must march to the very gates of Mordor to distract Sauron's gaze from the Ring-bearer as he gets ever closer to Mount Doom, into the fiery depths of which the Ring must be cast(n)
